description:
What's there not to like about here. 
.
Yea bright outside dark inside takes a min for the eyes to adjust. 
.
But as soon as I seen the prices which is lower than the one next door this is the place. Well I guess any saloon is always a place to crash at and fill up with good strong drinks. 
.
Well since I'm waiting for dinner might as well come in and get a drink. 3 dollar line star been a while since I last had some in San Antonio. 
.
Nice space, dog friendly, pool tables. And not pack on a weekday at least. Also they have purse hooks which we all love. Welp this is one of my new favorite place to get some beers when thirsty in the city. Thanks for reading and have a yelptastic day!
author: Alex T.

description:
Tried to order an Anchor Steam and the bartender says "We don't serve Japanese beers here." 

Oh, but it's fine to serve Lagunitas (Amsterdam parent co.); Stella Artois (Belgian); and Guinness (Irish). Gotcha. #FOH
author: Dyanna Q.

description:
I like that this is a laid back spot. 
Friendly crowd. I'd say, Mid 20s n above.

2 bars, one in front, one at the back. 

If you like to dance, good place. But its ovi, that music is some sort of spotify or pandora. But that's fine, because there is no cover fee. 

Cocktails are not that great so just get shots.

Wish they served finger food.
author: Sarah L.

description: If your a minority prepare for racist comments!!!! Walked in there hoping to have a good time ended getting a barrage of racist comments on the way out.
author: Tristeb D.

description:
One of the few mainstays on Polk Street

This bar is pretty long with two bars (front and back).  The drinks are moderately price with consideration to Mayes next door although similar to other bars on the block. Great place for dancing although not so great if you enjoy live mixing.  

For those who do enjoy dancing, the floor can be a little dirty and sometimes raunchy.  The place appeals younger individuals.  However, with a good group of people, you should be able to navigate and enjoy a part of your night out here.
author: Joel Christian A.

description: Best bar in the city by far, the bartenders are soooo good and make sure to take the time to get to know every client on a personal level. Love them all !! The drinks are good as always strong, super affordable and fun
author: Flower F.

description: This was pretty chill, low-key spot that I met some friends to watch a hockey game. Plenty of drink choices and a decent sized space with pretty good seating. There were no less than 6 TVs and we were able to watch our game with no problem. Great spot to grab a few beers and catch a game. There's no food offered here, but did see that some customers brought in food from outside places. So plan accordingly.
author: Ben M.

description:
AMF ($15): served in a tall cup, like a pint for beer. Strong AF.

+Dance floor in the back
+Bathroom is small and a little dinky, 2 stalls
author: Telena V.

description:
Came here last Friday to take out family from out of town.

Was looking for another place in the area but this place seemed to be the lively! 

There was no cover which was nice. The three security members were outside checking ID's. That processed seemed easy enough. 

Once inside you first see the open floor area, the bar to the left, and some booths over to the far right. I didn't get a chance to travel any further back because it was packed but not to the max yet.

When to the part first to get some drinks. It seemed like this place was a bit understaffed. Lots of people were ordering drinks but only a few were being attended to you. I couldn't help but see the blatant conversation going on between two bartenders who were not helping anyone until they had decided to end their conversation and then decided to attend to the eager customers looking to order drinks, just odd and peculiar but oh well I guess.

The vibe of the crowd was mixed. I would say that the demographic was that of early to late 20s. Not too much of a rowdy crowd but eventually the Saloon did eventually fill up. 

The bathroom was gross but that was to be expected. Just foul in every way imaginable.

The dancing is not really what you anticipate but then again it is a bar not a club. Everyone is dancing in their own world, more or less. If you come with a group then you should be good but be careful. There are some questionable folks that will wonder around looking suspect and suspicious, hold your wallets and phones close to you. 

Stayed here till about midnight and then we had to go. This place just did not meet the expectations of a Friday night in San Francisco. Might have to give Vertigo Bar a try next time. Just an okay experience.

Oh, some of the mixed drinks are a bit watered down. That is probably a result of the amount of ice that is used in making their drinks. 

Best of luck to you all off you that choose to "LIVE IT UP" here on a Friday or Saturday night.

#BottomsDown
author: Robert F.

description: I waited in line. All my friends got their ids checked, and got in (one of them even had an expired id and got in). The bouncer took one look at my Texas ID, and said "Texas ids tend to be fake. You can't come in. We have the right to deny you service". My id was real, but he said I couldn't come in.
author: Jojo Y.

description:
Best Guinness pour in the city and it's not even an Irish pub.  Although you wouldn't know it with two Irishmen behind the bar.  This saloon is what bars should be.  Great crowds, great service and great beer.  Everyone in McTeague's takes pride in what they do and it's apparent in all the beverages poured.

If you are looking for a pub with history and a great place to meet new friends, this is your place!
author: Joshua S.

description: I love this place! Great drinks and the best service ever! Great selection of beer on draft including some unexpectedly delicious craft brews along with traditional favorites. The bartenders for fantastic. They are friendly and extremely talented mixologists. Stop in for a Cheers feel bar.
author: Christie S.

description:
A lively dive bar on Polk.  Great music for anyone who enjoys hip hop and R&B, but don't expect much in terms of drinks...mediocre cocktails and a draft selection limited to light beers, Guinness, etc. served in plastic cups.

Perfectly cool with good company as the booths towards the back are a good spot to hang out.  Otherwise, look elsewhere.
author: Eric F.

description:
The music here sucked. Music genre was bouncing from one to another for every song - slow song to rap to who knows what. 

On the plus side, drink prices are somewhat decent here - several bucks for a drink. 

Not a fan, but it does get decently crowded towards midnight.
author: Becca S.

description: Any dog friendly bar in SF gets 5 stars in my book! The drinks are good too, multiple TVs and a pool table.
author: Megan D.

description: I've been coming to McTeague's for 10 years. Went back sat night got my drinks. I look at the drinks and see they are in much smaller cups than they used to be. I ask the bartender did the cups get smaller ?  He says no I look weirdly at my friend- he then asks why are you making that face ? I've been making these drinks for 10 years. So fucking rude, you know which one you are. I've been going to this bar for 10 YEARS TOO, no need for that rude comment.
author: Nessa H.

description: My Bestie and I stumbled across this gem of a bar while in SF for a short getaway. The plan was to Bar hop and take in as many places as we could in one night, once we stepped foot into McTeagues our Bar hopping came to an immediate end. The Bartender Stephen is by far my favorite part of our visit, he is friendly and sweet and makes the perfect Kamikaze. If you are looking for the type of place that feels like home the 2nd that you sit down look no further than McTeagues!!
author: Greta H.

description: Small joint; watered down drinks, bartender in the sparkly dress on New Years was a total bitch.
author: Genna N.

description: They're terrible at letting people that don't have a California ID into the bar. All my friends got their California IDs checked and got in. When the bouncer saw my Washington driver's license, he asked if I had another form of ID (as if I would be carrying around my passport) and when I said no he said we can't accept your ID. It's pretty ridiculous that they didn't let me in on the basis of having a non-California ID, even though it was a legit form of identification. Would not recommend if you're coming from out of state.
author: Rachelle Y.

description:
Lol I never know how to review dive bars. Like what's the criteria here? How do you review these places with the same scale as a nicer establishment?

As many Polk nights end up, a group of friends and I were at McTeague's around midnight on a Saturday (or Sunday I guess). There was a long line, but it moved pretty quickly. I think it took about 15-20 min before we got in. Main thing that my friends wanted to come here for -- no cover and a good time. I've never been, so didn't really know what to expect. Kind of got the typical dive bar scene but with so many angry people ?? So many drunk people spilling beer and yelling at each other, this place was just a bit way too aggressive for me scene wise.

The music was primarily rap and hip hop. The inside is actually fairly large, though it obviously gets crowded. It's a pretty good place to jam, that is if you get over the typical lurking crowd of men looking to prey on women. So I guess my 3 star review is more attributed to a less than desirable crowd in my personal opinion. If I want to have a divey night out, there are other places I would rather go to. 

Service wise though, the bouncers here are super nice. Not nice like will let you in with your fake, but just super nice, friendly and awesome people. The SO and I chatted with one of the bouncers, he was an interesting dude who carried on a great conversation and even said goodbye to us on our way out. That's a real nice touch of service you just don't get at most places. 

tldr; overall, I thought it was an okay bar, but don't feel a strong affinity to come back. I thought the people who worked there were awesome though!
author: Jasmine X.

description: Cool vibe in this dimly lit bar. Lots of wood and old time decor.  Lots of fun petting the dogs roaming around and chatting with the owners.
author: Paul S.

description: Always a place to stop when you are in sf. It's in a great location by multiple places. When I go bar hopping with my friends on Polk street this is one of my favorites. Typically during the weekends it's busy and there is a line outside, however I think it is worth the wait. Another thing to keep in mind is that there is usually a cover charge usually about $10.
author: Christina C.

description:
Divey forsure!

Weekend Security were hustling and doing a great job during St. Patricks Day.
author: Krishneel K.

description:
UNEDUCATED, DISCRIMINATORY, & IGNORANT POLICY- they wouldn't take my ID because I'm from Guam and wouldn't give me a reason. It's a US territory learn about it sometime. The bouncer couldn't give us any reason nor a manager to speak to regarding their ignorant & discriminatory policies.  The bouncer couldn't even speak to me like I was a human being and just ignored me the second he saw my ID. Apparently there wasn't a manager available to speak to tonight either.

When I mentioned their company would lose business because of their arbitrary policies (he probably never heard of guam and therefore found my ID as fake) he says "oh not necessarily" so I guess that means they don't care about losing business to people from anywhere outside of the state or people from a place that isn't a huge city.
author: Marin J.

description:
Came here on a FRIDAY night. Nothing special. The decor was old and music wasn't great. Outdated music?! McTeague smelled like puke even early in the night. The floor was sticky as well. Drinks are overpriced for an outdated bar. The probably have to remodel if they are not in a good location. 

Just another old smelly dive bar on Polk. Only plus side is no cover charge.
author: Sandy B.

description:
In a lot of parts of the United States, McTeague's would be the best bar in town.  Right?  

They open early and have a great selection of European Matches, and they draw a knowledgeable crowd.  They have a big selection of Drafts, range of $7 Cocktails, and higher end Whiskey/Scotch offerings.  I love watching sports here, and they have a lot of TV's.  It's a big place, and it draws a diverse crowd.  It is really one of the better Sports Bars in SF, and if you are from out of town and want to watch Football (EPL, not NFL) in the AM, you can't miss here.  6:30am on the Weekends, if I'm not mistaken.  You should also check out their art - I have some photos posted.

I don't know a lot about the history, but I know it dates back to the olden days of the 1800's.  I can only imagine Polk Gulch at that point.  It's diverse and rough-and-tumble now, but to think of dirt streets and a whole continent between you and The East (and no airplanes)...  I think this place helps us retain some of our Old School Awesomeness.
author: Adam S.

description:
Seeking a tourist trap with rude bartenders wearing cowboy hats for a more "authentic" vibe?  Found your spot!  Pump up the Nickelback and enjoy!!

Characterless interior and lackluster service in an area where significantly better options abound.
author: David M.

description:
They have no cover charge here which is great because many bars on Polk charge on Friday nights. Ambiance is nice and drinks are decently priced for San Francisco. 

P.S. for ladies, they have a secret restroom hidden on the left of the girls restroom with no sign on the door. If there's a long line and you need to go, look for this restroom!
author: Lushi Z.

description:
If you're at least heavily buzzed and ready to dance like an inflatable air man, then there's a small chance you will have fun. Anymore sober and reality will hit you hard (trust me, I was DD, more sober than the Pope). Grimy, hot and stuffy, chaotic, sticky floor, puking smell blends with sweat, loud sucky music with old weird decor. 

They stuffed people in as  if they were making bratwurst. Drinks are too expensive for a dive bar (~12 bucks for a mai tai & other cocktails). While waiting for your drunken friends to come to their senses (will not happen), I challenge you to a game of no-contact: you weave around without touching anyone(Hint: you will lose every time, your crotch (boobs for girls) is the weak point, it will make contact).
author: Minh V.

description:
Had a nice evening with their cocktails and loud music. Staff is friendly.

It's little crowded, otherwise nothing to complain about.
author: Ranjit M.

description: I've only been late at night. Fun place, bigger than it looks from the outside. Usually worth the wait if there's a line.Great music and the beers aren't as over priced as most places in the city. Last time there was a little too much standing around and not enough dancing going on.
author: Jackie L.

description: Not a bad bar. Hardly anyone was there on a Wednesday night, and service was fast and easy. Drinks were a bit pricey, but I would definitely come back. The place has a nice aura to it--good for a chill night hanging with friends but I also get the impression it can get pretty busy and crowded on Friday/Saturday nights. There were two main bar areas in the front and back to order drinks, but since it was Wednesday night, only the front portion/seating was open.
author: Tony A.

description:
Oh McT's, how we love you. Whether it's the line dancing lessons, the MNF parties, the crazy and terrifyingly demented halloween decorations, or the huge line out front for 4-deep at the bar, we keep coming back.

Why? Girls. McT's has the best flow of any bar in the area and on pub crawls, theme days (SantaCon) or Halloween, it never disappoints.

Sure, the floor smells like a frat house kitchen and people camp out in the scant seating like they are camping overnight, but we love it, and we always come back.

Affordable drinks, fun bartenders, lots of TVs, and fun people. If this place every get's bought and turned into a frou frou hipster bar I swear, someone will burn it down (and trust me, with the years of spilled liquor seeped into the woodwork, it will go up like a matchstick house)
author: Mike V.

description:
You know I actually liked this place. 

We don't have much 'Saloons' in Hawaii. The ones we do have, doesn't give you that country vibe this place did. We also came on a Thursday, which is apparently their country night. 

The bartender that was helping us was awesome! He was super cool and patient with us.
author: Ariana M.

description: Great vibes as soon as we walked in, the bartender was very welcoming! Made a drink of his choice for me that hit the spot! Great  dance floor and music. Definitely recommend going .
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
My friend and I have been to this bar numerous times and have never been really disappointed! Yes on Saturday's it tends to be very crowded (what place doesn't though) and hard to move around in, but they have a small upper level that my friend and I always end up dancing on that gives us a little more space. Drinks are about $7 if you wanna get fancy with it, and the alcohol ratio is fair.
    The only reason i did not give this place 5 stars is because on some nights for some reason the music is not to hot , well at least for dancing. More rap/slow songs. I personally am into  twerk music when I am out... but sometimes they are on point with their music, luckily if you go to polk there are a ton of bars and dance clubs in walking distance. I do recommend to check it out though because it was still a lot of fun and has a good vibe!
author: Devon H.

description:
Did Litquake choose this venue for its Goodreads Lit Quiz event for its name? McTeague is the title of a novel written by Frank Norris around 1899 about an eponymous dentist who opens a dental office on Polk St. in San Francisco.  I talked to one of the Litquake volunteers and he said the place wasn't chosen for its name but for its size. 

This is a pretty sizable bar.  You wouldn't think so from the outside but it is inside. The main bar counter is long and there are booths and bar stools across from the bar. Plenty of seating for those who want to sit. Beyond the bar is another room in the back with a smaller bar, several more booths and more bar stools and big barrels as tables. 

There are weird stuff on the wall as well as ceiling. There is a huge sign by the women's restroom warning people of phone thefts.  This place was crowded the night we came, as people were watching the Giants game. I can't speak about their cocktails because we just had beer here.  They have a lot of TVs, so it's a good place to watch sports. We saw people bring in food purchased outside the premises to have with their beer too. Not a bad place to get together with other Giants fans to watch the game and for nerds like us to compete in a literary quiz!
author: Hazel C.

description: This is a very large bar that extends far into the building with different rooms with multiple bars. It's a little more on the ratchet side. People were drunk and acting rowdy. It's way too loud to come here for a lounge feel. I'd recommend this bar if you're looking for hip hop and lots of dancing room.
author: Evana L.

description: The music was amazing, no cover, and great dancing. Drinks were also reasonable. My only complaint is the $15 minimum for using a card.
author: Kyle L.

description:
If I could leave zero stars I would; I actually created my yelp account solely for this review. I really love this place, but it unfortunately has a problem with attracting thieves. In 2015, two of my close friends had their iPhones stolen out of their back pockets. As I completely felt for them, I did not want to discredit the bar because I loved it and bad crowds can be found anywhere; especially in a city.

I came back to the bar this last Saturday, the 9th and was there for about 30 minutes. I had one drink within this time span and went back to the bar to get another. I ordered my drink and opened my purse to pay and my iPhone, debit/credit cards, and license were gone. I am not one to lose things, nor have I ever had anything stolen from me.  A reminder that my purse was ZIPPED, so the people that are doing this obviously know exactly what they are doing.

Furthermore, once I figured out my cards were missing, my boyfriend asked the bar tenders if there were any tabs open under my name because my things had been stolen. They said that there were not, and with this being said they should have been on alert looking for my name. I was not able to cancel my cards until I got home, and the next day there were three large charges on my account from McTeague's. Fortunately, I can have the charges reversed and purchase a new iPhone, but the fact that the bar tenders were alerted and still did not catch this is a bit concerning.

Over all, I am sad to have to leave this review, but within the last year multiple items have been stolen from my friends and I here. Security told me that this kind of thing happens all of the time here. If this is the case, WHY isn't there security inside keeping an eye out? It is one thing to set your things down and have them stolen, but it is another to have them stolen from you while you diligently have them in your possession. 

My point in writing this is so that this does not happen to anyone else. It's a terrible feeling and I would not want anyone to have to deal with this. Hopefully McTeagues can solve this problem.
author: Racquel T.

description:
Inexpensive*
Nice place to grab a drink on a Thursday night; clean when I was there at 8pm. Friendly security guards and friendly bartenders.




*perception of expenses may be skewed from living in LA and bay area
author: Trang B.

description: Decent music on weekend nights and no cover. Thumbs up in my book. It's a great place to hang out at if Mayes next door has a huge line - and cover.
author: Tina T.

description:
Came here early to watch the Warriors Final Game and hopefully have a victory party but that was not the case. I sat in the back to watch on the game on the big screen and had the awesome bartender Tony. He was great and promised I could be his first order and I was. I was also his last after my team lost :(
Still had a great time though. I've been here for plenty of crazy Friday and Saturday nights with my best friend. Always a good time at this place. The people are generally friendly, including the security up front and it's never super overly crowded to the point it's unpleasant. Always just on point.
author: Jessica L.

description: This place was fun!! Great lil vibes in there. Love the shuffle board! Great beer on tap!! Will def stop back by when I'm in town again
author: Tuna O.

description:
Eeehhh.. I've been here about 3 times. And while the crowd is okay, the actual environment is pretty unbearable for me. Right when I walk in..all I smell is vomit. Excuse me? The first time I came was for a friend's bachelorette and we went bar hopping--I thought maybe someone did puke. Second time...was confused. Last night we got there at like 10p!! It STILL smelled awful! There's this sour smell right as you walk in, it wasn't even crowded last night. Makes me think this smell never goes away..

For somebody who has a sensitive nose, I can't deal. There must be other places that don't smell so disgusting upon entry. =/
author: Emily C.

description:
Nice pub on Polk and Bush. It's called "Saloon" and that should give you a hint - Thursday's is Country Night! Love it or hate it - the rest of the week you'll find this bar to be a good mix of Irish pub, American sports bar, and your typical dive spot. 

For the Country Nights they offer line dancing lessons (it's tough to follow even if you haven't had a drink yet!). It's a fun and mixed crowd and the drinks are good.

Check out the specials - $2 Longnecks on Thursdays.
author: Sebastian F.

description:
I specifically signed up for yelp just to write this review.
This review is strictly for the bouncer, Tyrome (I don't remember his exact name but he's the tall black guy)
I lost my purse here on a Friday Night and returned to the bar on a Saturday
only to find out that the bouncer found my purse on Friday night and returned it to the bar.
Tyrome is freakin awesome,This man deserves a raise.
Despite the shitty situation I got myself in that night, I was thankful I got all my belongings back expect my iphone.
Ladies, I would be extra careful coming out this area, gets super sketchy late at night
You would not want to be stuck in the shitty position that I'm in.
author: Victoria y.

description: This bar has its pros and its cons. Drinks were reasonably priced, music was good (but they play it from weird locations so it's not very loud in parts of the bar). The glass floor is light up in one section and cool, but some are broken and it looks kind of janky. Finally; I don't know if my group had a bad night or what, but 3 people lost or had stolen their iPhones. Another friend who was not there later said that bar is notorious for pick pocketing. So that is unnerving, be very careful with your belongings!
author: Alec T.

description:
Came here for the super bowl and the customer service was outstanding. No cover and free complimentary pizza and wings?? I'm in! 

In a time when everyone was trying to charge extra because of the super bowl, McTeagues focused on helping out fans and providing great customer service. 

The crowd was there to have fun, no issues, no obnoxious kids.  The bar tenders were personable, approachable and downright friendly. We had a great time.
author: luis m.

description: This is a pretty chill bar! There's two parts to it, which I like. You can just hang out in the front and drink. There are some places to sit and/or stand around tables. Then there's a dancing area in the back and they play bomb music. I was drunkenly obsessed over the rubix cube looking light up floor in between floors.
author: Kelly G.

description:
Oh, you got problems?

There's a group called EVERYBODY and they all meet at the bar. 

Problems solved.

Especially on Thursday nights when it's $2 longnecks, $5 American Born moonshine and a lot of down home country folks rockin their boots on the dance floor. 

If country music ain't your thang, there's plenty of TV's to catch soccer and/or football games here too!
author: Janice C.

description: Was here during fleet week and it was crowded as fuck. The drinks were great and the small dance floor in the back was fun.
author: Katie P.

description: Always come to this bar to hang out with friends. Nice atmosphere on weekday. Not too crowded
author: Por P.

description:
A great selection of music [modern, country, dance...] + cheap drinks + nice employees + not crowded with douches = PERFECT for a party of girls to enjoy the first night of bachelorette fun!! 

:)
author: Katie F.

description:
WHOAAAA!

Everything was just fine here on a Saturday night here until I decided to head towards the back and crossed the invisible but VERY APPARENT line that lies smack-dab between the middle of the bar and the dance floor area right where the bathrooms are. 

I'm sorry McTeague's, ya'll get two stars for having good service and drinks at reasonable prices, but goooodlaawwwwd!!! I'll be damned if this place isn't the smelliest bar I've ever been in my entire life! I seriously felt like I got hit in the face by that locker-room-esque wall of odor that's trapped in the back. GET SOME FANS! or A/C in here NOW! 

I feel so bad for the people that have to work here. I had just gotten back from 8hrs at a festival on top of being 3 drinks deep and I couldn't even tolerate the pocket of stench for more than a few seconds. 

This is a decent sized venue and again the prices and service was good, but that lack of ventilation is inexcusable.
author: Bob Q.

description:
Great locals bar, with friendly owners, who occasionally will do a shot with out-of-towners that actually get the McTeague's reference...I think we found our new home away from home.

Lissa G and I popped in one afternoon to McTeague's Saloon solely based on the name since my wife is an English teacher book loving nerd, in a good way of course. The Saloon definitely felt like it had been there for a long time and had that old time feel, even though it has not been open very long. With gold teeth abound (McTeague reference - look it up) we settled in for a couple of drinks and pints of Guinness. 

The owners stopped by for a chat and to give us some great spots to try for dinner that night. All and all, friendly folks and a spot that will make you feel right at home.
author: Jim G.

description:
McTeagues is honestly one of the most fun bars I've been to here in the city. Very warm, friendly, and hilarious team of bartenders at the place, and more importantly - a good, clean, beautiful crowd! The drinks are great, the service is stellar, and just an awesome place to party, or even watch the game! 

I spent my New Years Eve here for their "Studio 54" themed disco party- and they really went all out.. Disco lighting and decorations. A photo booth. And even an LED Dance Floor! Most happening place on Polk street in my opinion.
author: Devin M.

description:
I've been to McTeague's twice. Once for a night out with the girls and just recently for the USA's first World Cup game. This place is great. They had the American Outlaws there and hosted a bunch of people who emptied out a few of the beverages on tap.

The bartenders: Very witty. If you can't take sarcasm or aren't able to throw it right back...brace yourself if you decide to say something dumb. They keep the ball rolling and do a great job of getting beverages out quickly. & when they're out of something know what you want as a back up. They do a really good job of making sure you get something to drink!

The beverages: At night they made me a bullet Manhattan on the rocks & they made it mighty fine. At 9:00 in the morning I was served a delicious tequila sunrise. I will say it didn't feel right ordering a tequila sunrise there but I also didn't want to order an OJ. Pick your poison. Oh the noon time whiskey sour is delicious too! That's not a new drink. It's just a whiskey sour at 12:00. Still delicious.

The bar: Got prime seats at the end of the bar close to the door for the USA game. Also got prime seats at a booth in the evening. They've got great seating no matter what you're looking for. It's not overly decorated which is great because no one wants to be assaulted visually by cheap themed decor. I will say look up at the ceiling. They've got a few pieces of art work that's pretty cool & there may be a chance for you to get educated on premier league teams.

The grub: Bring your own. There is a bunch of places you can take out from and they encourage it too. But don't be a Dirty D and leave your junk all over the place. If you ask nicely the staff will dispose of it for you if you can't find a trash can yourself. 

Note: It's a Saloon. Don't expect table service or to get a novelty "scorpion bowl" with a plethora of fruit. You'll upset the regulars and the bartenders. And no one will feel bad if they kick you out. Great place to grab a beer or some whiskey and watch the game.
author: Tam T.

description:
Part of the late night, bar hopping Polk experience starts and ends with McTeague's. Part Irish pub, part west coast "Saloon," it is a drinking sanctuary that accommodates all occasions and all crowds. Judging by the lines and how consistently packed it is nightly, it is by far one of the area's most popular bars.

Plenty on tap and drink specials for days, libations just never seem to end here. From the obligatory Guinness on tap to the Shiner Dark as well as cocktail deals, no one can or should go thirsty. I myself prefer a strong whiskey on the rocks, which they have plenty to choose from.

There is free pool, live music on occasion, and when in season, lots of sports playing on all the various TVs. It's a great place for Giants / 49er games and even better during MLS matchups. There is a small selection of pub food and even complimentary BBQ during weekend games.

When the crowds come and the ventilation suffers, that's when I'm out of here. Saturday nights around midnight can be a cluster of dbaggery, but then again, what place on Polk isn't inundated?
author: Jando S.

description:
Probably the only reason we'll come here on a weekend is because there is not a line.  You usually don't have to wait to get into McTeague's and there is no cover.  Once you get inside, it could be pretty crowded.  If you get there early enough, there are booths in the front and also in the back. 

There are 2 bars, one as you enter and another smaller one in the back.  The bartenders are nice and quick.  The drinks are average.  The one drawback about this place is that it is known for theft.  There have been so many times when I've come that someone has gotten their phone stolen.  Probably not worth the risk to come here if you are a girl.
author: Justin Y.

description:
I realllllly like this place because right off the bat, the bouncer was funny, chill and super nice! He was joking around with us and was so welcoming! Lol! Did I mention NO COVER! Yay! I came last night (Friday night, 12amish) and there's a bar in the front and a smaller room in the back with a bar which is a little more crowded. There are booths which is cool for groups. It was easy to get a spot in the bar to order drinks but remember that if you plan on using card, there is a $20 minimum. The bartender was quick and nice! I got a FireBall, a beer and a Jameson Pineapple for $20ish bucks, not bad! 

This place does not have a dance floor BUT it has this awesome small lit up area of flooring that you are allowed to stand on but cannot stand against the walls due to everyone walking through. Did I mention the bouncers inside were so chill and nice too?! Omg I wish I these kind of bouncers were everywhere I went! Lol!
author: Veronica A.

description: This place sucks. I've tried to go in 2 times and they haven't accepted my Mexican ID when every other place does. So fuck this place, I will make sure not to recommend this to anyone specially if they're only form of ID is a Mexican one. Like seriously what kind of bullshit is that.
author: SuckaNut V.

description: Had a great Saturday night here, was able to get a $10 margarita the was amazing and a AMF for $15 but it was a huge glass. Over all super fun, good vibes everywhere!
author: Nicole B.

description: Mediocre bar, terrible service. I waited 10 minutes to put in my order, bartender took the order of a woman that walked up after 1 minute of waiting. When I called him out and gave home a middle finger he had security escort me out. Never going back. BTW security thought it was funny and we socialized on the sidewalk while I waited for the people in my group to finish their drinks.
author: Michael F.

description:
Casual. Good jams. Decent drinks. Fun people. 

This was our first stop to a long night of bar hopping and boy am I glad we stopped here first! We had great drinks here to start the night and danced our little hearts away. This place had awesome mainstream and old school hits to sing our lungs out. 

Girlfriends and I will be back when in SF!
author: Gladys L.

description: Unassuming from the outside, but McTeague's is definitely a Polk street incumbent.  Super long, classic wooden bar is the center attraction while Irish decor is littered all around.  McTeague's boasts cheap drinks and a rowdy crowd.  The drawback being, the crowd may be a bit too rowdy on weekends, and the cheap drinks often end up attracting the wrong crowd if that means anything to you.  Great place to pound some shots and maybe get into a fight?
author: David C.

description:
This is a classic dive bar on Polk. I'd save it for the end of your bar crawl.

Pros: No cover charge. (At least we weren't charged) Crazy unique decor including a coffin hanging from the ceiling with a skeleton hanging out. There is a really cool lit up dance floor and there is a surprising amount of seating, if you can snag it.

Cons: It smelled like puke and the floor was sticky even though we were there at the beginning of the night. Glassware looked dirty as well. The music was really outdated so even though people gathered throughout the night and there was always someone trying to start the dance floor, it never really got started.
author: Kari G.

description:
Sad that I have to come all the way from Austin to San Francisco for line dancing, but McTeagues was worth the trip.

Added bonus: $2 longnecks.

Update: While I still like this place, after 3 visits I discovered my experience is unfortunately dependent upon when you go.  My last trip out was ruined by the a a scourge of vapid drunken college students.  One of them actually told me I "had to teach her" how to line dance and that "I was going too quickly" (said in the whiniest drunken tone possible).   I will be back, but I hope the night I choose has a more mature crowd!
author: Adina P.

description:
Bartenders will get to know you by name, remember your drink and high five you when the Giants score. 

In other words my type of drinking hole.

Listen its not too pretty, but if you want that walk down the street and fight for a place at the bar and squish shoulder to shoulder. Plus soccer is god here which is every drinking man's sport.
author: Timothy A.

description:
So, I have a love hate relationship with McTeague's. On one hand I love them because I have been escorted out more than once and they still let me come back. Friday night was another one of those nights of drunken debauchery. On the other hand I hate this place because it makes me want to rage like I am still in college. I have no idea why I always end up at McTeague's when I am completely annihilated. But thanks for dealing with me shouting "I'm the Duke of San Francisco, I OWN THIS BITCH" this last Friday and I apologize to the bartender that dealt with me. 

Fuck, I am 34 and still acting like this...

God I love San Francisco.
author: James N.

description:
I was surprised walking in this establishment that there were empty seats at the bar. I was further surprised that the micro-brew that I ordered was only $4 and so where many others too.

What's going on here? I don't think it was happy hour or anything. If so, $4 is still a pretty awesome price for a pint of beer in SF.

And I like the ambiance here too. Kinda looks like an old cabin with an electronic jukebox and a pool table in the back. So you can definitely tell that it as a "saloon" feel to it too.

Maybe I came in on an off-night for these guys, but I like the not-so-busy-feeling here, so I can see myself coming back to this bar again.
author: Mike C.

description:
Real Harp beer! God bless, the blessed owner Miles!
Best real Irish bar in San Francisco! I highly recommend meeting Seamus and the lot who make this place the best! 5 stars!
author: Anna L.

description:
Since moving to the Bay, the first time going out in the area neighborhood.

Bouncers: Super cool and were chatting it up with even though all my friends were behind me. All of the staff were pretty relaxed.

Bartenders: super responsive and made some really stiff drinks.  Most of my cup was vodka and there was a few drops of Red Bull in it. Yum. Typical prices.

Atmosphere: Enough room to walk around and didn't run into too many dbags. A few guys were creeping hard on my friends but eventually got the hint to be gone. 
Music was on point and I'm told it's off of a spottily account since there's no DJ. Computers taking our jobs!

Bathroom: Man that was gross so hopefully you don't have to do more than numero uno. If you do, god's speed.
author: Eric B.

description: Pretty sure we walked 10 blocks to go dance and there is no dancing here. The bartender told us haven't had dancing for over a year
author: Kevin M.

description:
Well. This ol boy from Texas figured out that they served Lone Star beer, so why not drop by? Lone Star was there. But as I sipped on some suds, Turnpike Troubadours can on the speakers. This is on a Monday, folks. Country shindigs go down on Thursdays, good on 'em. I reckon there's a taste of home here no matter the day. 
Give the barkeep Tony some love for me.
author: Steve P.

description:
I used to come here all the time and loved it (especially country  night on Thursdays, although I'm not sure if they still do that).

This weekend, I was there with some friends and they were playing videos of Nazi rallies/with Hitler speaking for at least 20 minutes. When my friend asked them to change it, they dismissed her with "Honey, don't take it so personally, have another drink".

Totally inappropriate. This bar is gross anyway and there are so many other good bars on Polk that I don't need to ever go back.
author: Alana C.

description:
I've never wrote about dive bars, so this would be my favorite one so far! 

*Spacious*

*Happy Hour*

*Pool Table*

*Great way to celebrate*
author: Kathy V.

description: Decent-enough bar. Not cheap and not expensive. Lots of TV's and chill vibe. Decent taps. No food, though, or I would have given it more stars. Bartenders can be hit or miss here. Bartender I had last time I think was Irish? He was attentive enough but doesn't know how to make some mixed drinks well. Just stick to beer and shots and you'll be fine.
author: MakeUp M.

description: Great for watching USA soccer games with the American outlaws.
author: Chase T.

description: A soccer bar! Hell yes. Also great prices and a friendly place. At night it gets pretty packed and there's a dance floor. Good during the daytime or nighttime.
author: Shawn T.

description: This is a very fun saloon. It's decorated in a very eclectic fashion with lots of sports flags & memorabilia lining the walls and ceilings. I can't comment on it's night life since I have only ever been here to watch Everton soccer games. The bartenders are very friendly and efficient. They are attentive without hovering and love to watch the soccer games with the patrons. They also won't judge you if all your order is hot black tea (like me!) The bartenders also remember the customers who come more regularly. They have a bar in the front and booths in the back if you want to sit removed from all of the action. The restrooms are clean as well, which is always a rarity in a saloon like setting. Nestled in the heart of downtown SF, I'd highly suggest this as a fun place to come watch any sporting event.
author: Alyssa L.

description:
It smells like poop by the doorway and I don't mean the outside. 

Sloppy people watching galore
author: Susy C.

description:
Came here to get turnt up on Saturday night and did just that.  The bar is pretty big, but its packed fast.  The crowd is somewhat diverse.  Actually I would say it is a good cross section of the SF demographic, pretty much a little bit of everything, where as some of the other bars on Polk skew one way or the other.  

Drinks are decently priced and they take card to it makes things easier.  Once you get your drink and find a spot, you can start partaking in the drunken fun which may or may not include drunken dancing and singing (as room permits).  I am pretty sure the music comes from somebody's ipod or computer since there is absolutely no mixing or focus on any particular genre...Top 40 though out the decades we have lived?

No cover and relaxed atmosphere works for me!
author: Veasna H.

description: Someone stole my phone here :( And the bouncers were very nonchalant about it.
author: Angela L.

description: Stumbled upon this place on a Friday night after leaving Mayes. There was a line to get in but luckily we saw a friend towards the front. No cover for guys or girls. Quick service at the bar, enough room to dance or just talk and hang out- whatever you prefer. Good amount of people. We had a lot of fun and I would definitely come back.
author: Samantha H.

description:
As a 28 year old grown woman, it depresses me slightly that the majority of my Saturday nights end at this bar. I have not moved on from getting blind drunk and getting incomparably excited by the sound of listening to the backstreet boys.

This place is usually a good time, it depends on the crowd, how drunk you are, and if they oblige and play enough spice girls and backstreet boys.

Sometimes you have to wait a while to get served, which is entirely for the best in the long run because they pour strong drinks here. I go from basic drunk bitch to cerebral palsy from roughly half of a gin and tonic here. Also, as this place gets packed toward end of night, you can assume everyone else here is also on their last, drunken leg as well.

It's definitely a younger scene, which can make you feel as though you are:

a) a cougar  
and/or 
b) an old desperate ho.

There is also one more option:

c) get so blind drunk that age becomes irrelevant. 

I often go for choice C before making out with a random 23 year old. It's pretty promising, good way to find future husbands, ladies.

Overall, it's a good place to end the night on Polk, always funny, always full of characters... Just need to find some more men here who are a bit further away from completing puberty.

Cheers mcteagues, see ya again this weekend.

PS girls:  8/10 times, you can definitely find hot British and Australian tourists here who are down to make out with you in public.
author: Valerie H.

description:
Oooww. I never thought there is a such a good place. Entrance looks kinda weird but once you step inside you are going to experience an amazing crowd with wonderful music. And they got great Sound systems too. No matter where you are, some random corner, Mini lounge or on the lighting dance floor you'll hear the same sound with excellent bass. This place is amazing and fully took over by Young crowd on Friday's and Saturday's. Thumbs up I'm going there again. 

But the only catch is, Minimum $15 for credit card transaction.
author: Vamsi T.

description: It's pretty cool in here. They have a bar area with tables and a small dance floor in the back. Went here on a Saturday because a friend recommended but we left because the music went from hip hop then pop and rock lol it was chill there but not the type of music we wanted to dance to.
author: Marilee A.

description:
Some very fanatic line dancers come here Thursday night which is a bit intimidating for the laymen. Still a fun time and cheep drinks. 

I would like to come on a different evening and check out the bar outside of honkey tonk hoe downs as its just one event of the week. Ambiance is cool too and not what I expected with a bar hosting a line dancing night.
author: Kristan B.

description:
I love this place! I've gone about three times and every single time was an experience to remember. Always good looking friendly people & great music. 

This place is usually crowded since it's one of the few bars with no cover charge on Polk. Love it.
author: Ruth B.

description:
I don't know what it is about this place, but every time I come here, I always have a great time! The crowd is great, the drinks are strong and the security guy out front is the sweetest! 

Only thing... Thursday is country night. What the F?! Are we in Texas? Are we in middle America?! Why is a fun SF bar having full on, line dancing, country night? My friend and I came in on this wonderful country night, had a drink, and came right out. Hopefully this only happened once...
author: Anastasia N.

description:
I don't understand why some people like this place so much. Maybe because I've only gone here on super crowded Friday and Saturday nights. You literally can't move through the bar without brushing against someone. It gets so stuffy and gross.

However, it's not the worst bar ever. They play decent music, but no one ever dances haha. Probably because there really is no room to despite the large area. At least the drinks are cheap!
author: Stephanie G.

description:
Went on a Tuesday night around 8p, not crowded at all. Was told by the *extremely* inebriated and angry bartender that we weren't allowed to order any cocktails on the menu, that he's only doing beer and shots. He said if we wanted a cocktail, we should get out. 
They have cocktails menus all over the bar, unclear why he wasn't willing to do it. There were maybe 6 people at the bar, and an additional 20 scattered throughout the rest of the pub. It was not that crowded, just incredibly uncalled for rude and poor service.
author: C Y.

description:
DISGUSTING, ABUSIVE & UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF!

I live down the street on Polk and decided to check this place out on a Friday night with some friends. When we got there there, was a small line but we got to the front in  a minute or two, and were looking forward to a fun night at a local bar. That was until I was confronted by the most rude, unprofessional, and disgusting bouncer I've encountered in my life. 

The bouncer asked me for my ID, glanced at it for a second, and proceeded to tell me it was fake - mind you I'm 25. I legitimately thought he was joking with me so I said "you're joking right".. for some reason, that one really ticked him off. He came right up to my face (to the point where I could smell the alcohol on his breath, which is an entirely different problem), and told me to get the F*** out of his doorway. 

When I told him to take another look because I'm 25 and my ID is real, he grabbed me by the arm, threw me to the ground and told me he was going to step on me if I didn't leave the premises!  I don't care if this guys job is to bounce the door -  he has absolutely no right to physically throw a girl on the floor!

Neither I nor my friends are EVER going back to McTeague's saloon... no one else should either until they:

1. Teach their bouncers how to do their job and properly read ID's
2. Understand that it's against the law to have their bouncers drinking on the job
3. Fire the disgusting bouncer who thinks it's ok to physically abuse a potential patron for no reason

There are plenty of other great bars on polk with respectful staff, and really anything is better than McTeague's Saloon
author: Siiana A.

description:
They insulted my Mexican hombre at the bar for ten minutes, all he was trying to do was get a drink...   they were yelling at him and telling him that we weren't welcome because of the language difference... All he did was stand at the bar for half an hour, patiently trying to get service....


Im not returning, ever.
I appreciate diversity.
author: Bryan V.

description:
Cheap drinks with a very diverse crowd.  I came with some friends here on a Friday night and there was no cover.  There is definitely no shortage of guys here, but I guess thats pretty typical of the dive bar scene.

They have a bar up front as well as another bar at the back of the place.  The back bar is definitely less packed.  In the very back there are some hidden tables which is nice if you want to just chill with the people you came with.
author: Richard L.

description:
It pays to be a mellow, fun loving kind of chap at McTeague's. Why? The bartenders will remember you, treat you well, and they will be your best friends. Like best friends do, they are willing to back you up when the time comes.

By nature I'm a very relaxed guy. I like to watch football here for 6 hours and chat it up all Sunday long. A few weeks back though, I came as close to knocking out some teeth as I have in a very long time. A drunk, mouthy individual would not shut up. He just wouldn't, and he was directing his booze soaked ire to the left side of my face. For about 30 minutes.

The observant bartenders warned him. They told him he was pissing people off and needed to have a nice glass of shut the hell up. But would he listen? Nawwwwww, he was drunk. You know how that goes.

The bartenders who know me, know my demeanor, could smell something was wrong. The comments after the fact were that they'd never seen Justin like that before. I was ready to rip his head off. Perhaps me smacking his hand out of my vicinity and yelling point blank two inches from his face to shut the fuck up gave me away. I'm not positive.

Before I snapped and caught me an assault charge they 86ed him and sent his ass packing. That's good business right there, they recognized me as a regular and a fairly happy one at that. To evaluate and say hey, we know this guy and he's not like this. Something is amiss, we need to fix it. Well played, if it wasn't me that douche would have been pissing off another patron, I guarantee it.

I calmed down about 10 minutes after he bounced. We had a shot and laughed it off. I tried to buy but they were having none of it. I explained the sitch to maybe 10 bar goers who approached me and said "Dude... you were super pissed..... what did he do?" Luckily it went no further, McTeague's had my back and vicariously that means if you're a good customer who doesn't start shit, they'll back you up too.

I really appreciated that. Some bars will ignore and let the dust settle as it will. They treated me, a frequent visitor, with respect and remedied the situation before that asshole made me remedy it myself. I like McTeague's, and I like knowing that they care enough to take care of decent customers. I can honestly say I feel like they're my friends and I look forward to seeing their faces every time I roll through. 

Much love Amber and Rick, much love. I'm sure Mr. asshole thanks you too, he got to keep his teeth.
author: Justin N.

description: McTeague's is a great, not-too-divey, Irish bar. It's pretty spacious (try to walk all the way to the back if you plan to stay for a while!) with solid music options and friendly staff. On Halloween they had a candy bar and a lot of fun decorations (another reason to go to the back!). If you're wanting to show out-of-town friends a good time, definitely bring them here.
author: Elizabeth W.

description: Just one stop of many in Polk street bar hopping. The drinks are good and it's always crawling with people. I just hate how the DJ plays the songs where you actually listen to the end of the song where it gets real quiet and awkward before it begins to another song. It also gets really hot and smelly in here during the peak hours. Might come back with friends if we're bar hopping.
author: Helen J.

description: This place smells like vomit, BO, piss, and ass.  On weekends, it gets packed, shoulder to shoulder and there is no ventilation.  The floors are sticky and wet.  If you love all that, then I can't think of a better place for you.  I have been several times and the experience is the same each time.  No mas.
author: Victor C.

description:
This place was great.  After a few hours of sightseeing, I needed to find a watering hole.  I decided to duck in here and see what was up with the opening ceremonies for the Olympics.  It was about 9pm when I went in and was pretty dead.  There were some people sitting around the bar and a few more sitting at some tables.
My drink was alright, if you like a super strong pour.  For my first drink, it was more than I wanted, but I drank it anyway.  Not one to waste a drink, you know?
Loved the high back booths that make you feel like you're the only ones there.  I can see those working out well for a date night because they're dark and kind of intimate.  Several tvs were mounted behind the bar, 3 for the Giants game and 3 for the opening ceremonies.  As an hour went by, the place started to fill up and by the time I left at midnight, it was packed.

Best thing about this place was the decor - eccentric is a good word.  There were all sorts of things hanging from the ceiling and on the walls.  If I were on Polk Street looking for a bar, I would definitely go here again.
The bartenders were attentive and this is definitely the place to go to chill with friends.
author: Samantha E.

description:
Watch out if you pay cash, especially if you have an accent. Went here with two of my foreign friends, one Aussie and a Brit. We each ordered 3 whiskeys with Coke chase.   I was charged $21 and then the next was charged $31. Upon complaint, he was given $10 back, and thanked me because he had no idea the price. Then my English mate went up for THE EXACT SAME ORDER an was also charged $31. I told him to count his change and after he complained, the MANAGER!!! who served him gave him $10 after a death stare competition. 
Now, you tell me, what kind of legitimate bar makes the same mistake twice in a row, and admits so quickly that they were wrong??? I called him out on it, and was kicked out of the bar for backing my mates up. DO NOT PATRONIZE THIS BAR. If you do go, pay with card or know the drink prices. Its a big scam and the manager Simon is a scrub who cheats customers.
author: Chris W.

description: I love this place. It always has the right vibe and the bartender who works the right side of the front room bar, Lindsey, is the best fucking bartender in the city bar none!
author: Raymond P.

description:
Don't ever go here. I've been going to bars for so many years and have always kept my eye on my things and this place is a target for things to be stolen. In one night our group had three things stolen. A sweater, my leather jacket (I believe it it was people who asked to sit next to us) and even turning away for help with carrying shots someone took one of my shots for my friends. This bar is a target for theft and is frankly not worth it. Coming out of the bar a poor girl was crying about her phone getting stolen. I think the only reason why my bag wasn't stolen is because I was skeptical of these people sitting next to us and I moved it. When we informed security they could give two shits. Given the level of theft here witnessed in only one night I think this place gets targeted. Don't go. I don't often write reviews and this experience triggered one. I tried to talk to the employees and they weren't having it.

Sad. Don't spend a dollar here.
author: M B.

description:
One star because of the theft problem.

I, along with numerous others, had my phone lifted from my pocket last night. According to staff, this has been happening incredibly frequently. Quite a few girls are having their purses stolen as well. Be extra careful and aware or your surroundings while here. This has never happened to me before, and I'd consider myself to be very careful.  It's incredibly unfortunate that this is happening, as this one experience has ruined this bar for me.
author: Cara M.

description:
Won't ever be going back here, taking any of my friends back here, or recommending to anyone that they ever come here for anything.
Was enjoying a good time at the bar during Santa Con when some dumba** put his shoulder into me on his way out. Apparently his brother had earlier tried to dance with my girlfriend, who called his elf outfit gay (...we'd been drinking, lol).
Before I knew it the dude was all over me, trying to get a punch in, but I just held his arms trying to deescalate the situation while he tried to shove me. 
I ended up getting kicked out while the dude and his brother verbally harassed my girlfriend. She tried to tell the bouncers and bartender what was happening, who ignored her.
I know Santa Con is a busy time for the bars, especially on Polk St, and they have to deal with a lot. But it was just unacceptable that the bar employees ignored my girlfriend while she was asking for help.
Like I said, never drinking here again or taking anyone. And anyone who asks about McTeagues will get the absolute worst recommendation from me.
author: Nick G.

description: Me and my friends are always out at Mcteagues. It has a great crowd and great music with a dance floor.  A good open space to dance and chat. The drinks are not too expensive and the staff are nice.
author: Marian P.

description: Really nice open space with good music playing.  It was a good start to the night as we were there for the first stop of the night since we were out early and able to talk and socialize while there.  The drinks were served quickly.  Not sure on the pricing of the drinks but they were tasty and had good alcohol content.
author: Allison A.

description:
Seeking a bar with a bigger dance floor, my friends and I were directed to McTeague's Saloon. Not quite the crowd we were looking for but I didn't mind the place at all.

Very casual atmosphere with seemingly chill people. I mean, it's a pub. Very spacious and a pretty big bar area. Didn't get to try the drinks because we didn't stay long.

Definitely a bar to hangout in just to chill and catch up.
author: Sofia R.

description: I love this place! I don't know if it's the throwback songs that play throughout the night, the casual atmosphere, or the fact that it's not skin-on-skin crowded. Approaching the bar to buy a drink is easily doable, something that cannot be said for every bar in the city. I had come here with a couple friends about a month ago, and brought some other friends two weeks later. We started our night here and my friends loved it! It was a great place to dance, get our blood flowing and get a couple drinks. The bartenders were friendly, and I love that there are two bars inside. Definitely recommend this place for anyone who loves a good dive bar every now and then.
author: Aparna T.

description: Standard bar. Drinks are not super pricey, nor cheap. I've been twice now, once on a Friday and once Saturday. Both times I've been the bartenders pour weak drinks. Make sure to ask for what alcohol you prefer and pay a little extra for top shelf. This place can get crowded. Standard crowd meaning 20-something....closer to the young end though. The music is current hip hop and pop. I cannot attest to what other reviewers said about pick pocketing here, so I am not sure. Word to the wise, never leave anything unattended at any bar and it'll never get stolen. Put your wallet and phone in a zipped front pocket. Easy.
author: Ms. F.

description:
Wife and I went here last night (Thursday) to check out their country theme night. We just moved to the Bay Area from Texas and thus were thirsty for Texas bear and country music. McTeague's definitely helped quench our thirst on both accounts! As for music, they were playing all the good classics as well as some good newer stuff.

Drinks were cheap and delicious! We enjoyed a few $3 Shiner Bock drafts and $2 Lone Star longnecks. They also have tacos and/or hot dogs for sale, depending on the night. Hard to find deals this good anywhere in the city!

We also met one of the owners (Chris was his name, I believe) who was super nice and generously offered us a drink on the house. We had fun chatting with him, and are happy to recommend his establishment!
author: Juan F.

description:
This is my new go-to spot on Polk St.  Fantastic location, great drinks, large venue, and reasonable prices.  A great place to stop in for a drink (or several) while you bar hop on Polk St.

On a separate note, these guys are very big on US Soccer and always have the games on.  They provide sound and tv screens during big games, and have a separate area in the back can be utilized if there are other games going on (Warriors, 49ers, etc.)

When Jesus is around to make food, definitely order something!  He makes delicious tacos and charges very affordable prices.  Great bar food to munch on while watching sports.
author: Aalok P.

description:
I saw people trying to play twister with the lights on the floor. Cus its big enough to play twister on the floor...

Cheap drinks. Bad decisions. Friendly bar staff. Good times.
author: Emily D.

description: This review is good and bad. The good is for the bar itself. I walked in and it was very welcoming. They even offered to buy us our first round! Plus, the music they were playing was amazing. It was a great place at first. However, the bad is for the bouncer. I've never met such an ignorant man. He took my friend's ID (my friend being 23) saying it was fake, and proceeded to threaten him while calling him derogatory words. Not cool. We waited 50 mins for the cops to show up to get back the stolen ID. They called it in to verify it and it was indeed real. The bouncer then proceeded to tell the cops they were idiots and it was fake. Needless to say it wasn't a pleasant experience and now no matter how fun the bar may sound, i can't recommend it. :(
author: Samantha W.

description: Super chill.. Open before most bars in SF... Steve is awesome!!  Good Irish bar. Pool table. Good times.
author: Tracy S.

description: This place is shady as hell but I guess their choice of music isn't half bad. Spent a drunk night here, too.
author: Ruobin W.

description:
Super nice bar tenders at night and during the day. They're a soccer bar so they'll turn up the volume on important US games and I think they play EPL games even early in the morning. TVs line the wall behind the bar and there's TONS of seating. 

This is also a great place to go at night if you're on Polk street. It does get really crowded but it's definitely worth it since there isn't any cover and the drinks are cheap/strong!

Bloody Mary's are hot, hot , hot! And they give you pickled green beans. Yes, please and thank you! 

I love coming to McTeague's and I'm hoping the American Outlaws will make it their new chapter bar.
author: Christine B.

description:
If you want to get everything that matters stolen, come to this bar.

My friends and I came here for a fun Saturday night - by the time I left, I had my phone and debit card stolen. When I asked to speak to the manager (AFTER I was escorted out because I was "too emotional") all the security outside could say was "he's inside and he can't help you." 

I actually had $500 worth of things taken at this bar, and I heard three other girls outside who had the same complaint. Management took no responsibility and said it was a common occurrence every weekend - personally, there are much better bars to go to where this sort of thing doesn't happen.
author: Mehr G.

description: Michael the bouncer or security guard outside is really cool. Had a good conversation with him. This place is awesome to be at during the USMNT games it's off the charts. Good fun bar doesn't seem to have anything bad about it .
author: Kyle R.

description:
Made my first - and last - visit to Mcteague's last night. I agree w/ many of the other reviews. This place has a serious identity crisis going on. It's an Irish pub that thinks it's a night club of sorts. What sort, I don't know. 1990's rap and hip-hop music was blaring making it impossible to have a conversation, and the place was packed with wall-to-wall people, making it impossible to move. People were so intoxicated they were literally falling down, spilling their drinks, and subsequently the floor was covered in a mixture of various alcoholic liquids and broken glass. At one point I thought I was caught in the middle of a bar fight, but it turns out the wasted girl standing behind me in 5" heels couldn't hold her liquor anymore and fell ass-first onto the floor, knocking me from behind in her descent. Not safe. At all. 

They are definitely exceeding maximum capacity by a tremendous amount of people, violating fire and safety code(s) in the city. Trying to leave at 12:00A.M. was a nightmare. The crowd dynamics made it impossible to move, let alone leave the place. It was scary, and felt like I was about to be trampled. If anything were to happen, such as a fight, or misunderstanding between drunk people, the uncontrollable crowd dynamics would most definitely result in a serious crowd disaster. Over-crowded spaces like this can become dangerous places, if not well managed. Unfortunately, all of the 'security' was stationed at the entrance of the venue - not scattered throughout the bar, doing their jobs. They need to obey city code and stay within the limits of their capacity. 

It was a weird, low-brow, sketchy, bridge-and-tunnel kinda place, with dynamics that could escalate into a dangerous situation, quickly. Keep your wallets, pocket books and any valuables close to you. Or better yet, just go somewhere else, anywhere else... you're bound to have a better experience.
author: Beckz K.

description:
I came here for Halloween festivities and I was sober. This was obviously a mistake but it was during my 3month detox! I couldn't help it!

Luckily, we were able to snag the little nook right next to the door and front window. It was sooo crowded and gross inside. Granted, it was probably because of the holiday, but it wasn't pleasant in any way. Also, the bathrooms are so tiny. There were only 2 stalls and clearly they get a lot of guests! This was not ok!

I've been to some other places on Polk St, so I don't think I prefer McTeague's at all.. bleh
author: Erin H.

description:
MASS PICK-POCKETING OCCURRED HERE LAST NIGHT

PROS
- Minimal wait; can get in at midnight w/o question
- No cover
- Funny movies with subtitles playing
- Well-drinks only $5
- Lots of young adults

CONS
- Drinks are weak
- Not good for dancing (lack of space and dance music)
- No maximum occupancy enforced
- 6+ other women & myself (relatively sober) had their iPhones stolen from their purses
- No lost and found
- Lack of desire by security to look into the pick-pocketing issue when asked

Note to security: 
- Enforce max. occupancy 
You described that theft happens "all of the time," at your establishment, and yet have not taken measures to help alleviate it on your end.- even an announcement to the bar warning others and letting the perps know they are not welcome would have been a start.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Awesome spot. The drinks are good and not too bad price wise. The place is laid back and casual. There is usually a little crowd of random fun peeps to grab a beer with. Very clean place and they take good care of maintaining it.
author: Jeffery H.

description:
Had my Iphone stolen RIGHT OUT OF MY PURSE that was ON ME here. Although i've never had any other bad experiences here before...the crowd some nights can be a hit or miss. 

Watch your wallets and bags...thieves are all up in this joint
author: Yas G.

description:
Met a bunch of German dudes in my stay in SF last weekend, and decided to party it up with them. 

This was the first place on our stop, and it was crazy crowded. Also, total sausage fest, so yeah...

Anyways, the drinks weren't too expensive, especially for SF standards. I think it was like $5-6 for beer, and $7 for shots.

In an attempt to represent our country, I accepted my German brethren's' challenge in drinking, and downed shot after shot of Jägermeister, all for America. 

I came out on top at the end, but my liver definitely did not. 

Great place to start off the night, but at a 9-to-1 guy girl ratio, it won't be your ending spot.
author: Peter Y.

description:
I'm sorry McTeague's. I know people LOVE you- but I just can't get myself to do so- at least not yet.

Came here after dinner with some friends as soon as the 49ers had clinched the playoffs. I really, really wanted to like McTeague's but the crowd totally turned me off. 

Here's what McTeague's has going for it:

1) The price is right! For $16 we got two vodka soda's and a beer (maybe 2 beers- I didn't pay, so I'm not totally sure.) 

2) I LOVE the layout! This place looks like it should be a ton of fun! The funky colored floor in the back is straight out of a Michael Jackson music video (though on a much, much smaller scale.)

3) Your bouncers are awesome. (Not as awesome as the bouncer at the Latin America Club- he's still my favorite) Totally friendly dudes.

Here's what scares me about McTeague's:

Now that I'm in the Tender-Nob, Lower-Nob, Whatever, the crowd is looking seedy. Fights are breaking out and I feel like a minnow surrounded by sharks. My friend and I started feeling a bit unsafe and left.
author: Annalise F.

description:
Hell Ya! 

The place to catch League Soccer. Plenty of Tellies.
author: Madhusudhan R.

description: Bouncers are extremely aggressive and unreasonable.  A bouncer kicked out my friend because she was drunk. I had just bought $40 worth of drinks for my other friends so I asked if we could finish them and then leave.  The bouncer got super aggressive when I asked this, and demanded that we all leave immediately.  No one else was drunk.  He actually shoved my female friend! No need to get physical, dude. I won't be going here ever again.
author: Cayleigh W.

description: My friend and I visited this bar for a high school reunion. For the most part, the bar tenders were very accommodating. The reason why I am giving this place "2 stars" has nothing to do with the bar tenders OR music. My friend lost her wallet in the bar, or got her wallet "stolen." One of the bouncers/security told me he did NOT like me calling him "sir" when I respectfully called him "Sir," put his hand in my face and dismissed me when we asked if we could check through the bathroom for the wallet. He told me "In the same way you don't like me calling you "sweetie," I don't like being called "sir'". I didn't know what else to call him! And I'm sure most people know it is not the same dynamic. As a woman I felt oppressed and disrespected. ESPECIALLY when he put his hand in my face and dismissed me. At one point, he even yelled down to me right at my face. Mind you, I'm a little girl, standing at 5'1, and this man was no shorter than 6 feet tall. Even other bouncers couldn't put their chests up and fully defend him because even they saw how wrong it all looked. But of course, they weren't going to let their guard down on me either. I understand that bouncers are hired for a reason and are hired to prevent confrontation and further attention. And at the same time, I do understand that bars are not "liable" for lost/stolen items but ALL WE WANTED TO DO was check. If not allowed to check, we would have at least wanted to be been treated with respect, whether or not the wallet was there. We felt very disrespected and almost oppressed for this reason. Turns out the wallet was found. A minute ago. At the venue. Thanks but no thanks bar hoppers. I would like to visit this bar again, as I am a NATIVE San Franciscan. But it will be a problem if the bar hoppers/security talk to women this way again.
author: Katrina L.

description: Great casual bar for a beer & sports. Ok whiskey selection. Will definitely stop in again when I'm in the area.
author: Cody C.

description:
You came here with someone? What a shame. 

Everyone here seems to have their eyes on the crowd, or at least that is the case this Hallows eve. There is something about costumes that makes the male species bolder....but not brighter. 

I had a string of awesome conversations here. And by awesome I mean awkward, creepy, and a little perverted. 

One gentlemen told me and my cheerfully-buzzed gal pal that he's with child....going into a detailed account of how he was given a uterus and has been artificially inseminated. I vaguely recall this being the plot of a bad 90's comedy...

The next gentlemen tried his hand with an insult, telling us over the loud music, "You girls look like perverts!!" Oh, really? His friend then told us that we should stroke his balls. No, thanks. 

Then there was a very sweet man with a Pirate costume on, oh no that's not a costume? My bad. He told my (now beyond buzzed) pal that he once dressed up as a woman in college and was appalled by the way that men treated him in bars, and that he now has an increased respect for women. To you pirate lady-man: try bein' a lady in this bar!

Maybe its the throngs of has-been greeks who need to get their fix of the drunken antics among the 20 something crowd, or the girls who like to be fondled by strange men who gaze into your eyes as they walk through the crowd. To each his own! 

McTeague's gets 4 stars for entertainment on Halloween, but my college days were well lived, and I don't think this is the bar for me.
author: Jocelyn B.

description:
Ah no......definitely not.  Stopped in at Mc Teague's Saloon at about 3:30 this afternoon, with a friend who needed to talk.  I spent a LOT of time listening.  Anyway, we sat at the far end of the bar, near the door, and the bartender finally got around to us maybe fifteen minutes later.  There was a small group of  about 10 people  circled in one space at the bar, seemingly watching one TV.  Other than that there were only two other patrons.  We were there for at least an hour, and the bartender never approached us again.  Even when he gave the check to people very close to us, he never even looked our way.  I was really hoping for another drink; it would have made the one sided conversation much more bearable.  When I got frustrated enough to leave, the bartender was at the opposite end of the bar, watching TV.
Who hires these people?!?
author: janice s.

description: I'm not sure what the theme is here. I saw cowboy boots along with some other random things. It's nice that this place is pretty big, so we were able to fit okay in the back close to the other booths.  The bartenders were okay for the most part, except for this one guy (wish I got his name) who took so long to get me just a cup of water! He walked in the back to check the kegs and came back before he could get me water! It really is quick, dude. The music was pretty good from what I remember and it's nice that they have plenty of security guards walking around. I hate the disco ball in the back because it kept blinding me in the face.
author: Katherine L.

description:
Unpretentious and clean - somehow a hard combo for a not-fancy bar to hit!

I actually wandered in here the day after a Giants game, and the place was clean and the staff was right on it. Add to that the fact that they still had a sense of humor, and I immediately added McTeague's to my 'safe places to land' list. 

Also - nice bar, TVs have not TAKEN OVER through enormous size and oppressive VOLUME, and the barkeep was actually playing the jukebox every time commercials came on. Nice touches that make it possible to hang out...
author: K W.

description:
There are....a lot of guys here. Yes, as others have said, total sausage fest. For the good part of the time my friend and I were there, we were the only females besides the bartenders. 

Speaking of the bartenders....they kind of ignored customers and talked with each other while customers were waiting. Um, excuse me? At first we thought it was because they wanted to take care of the male customers first....but, nope....just stood there talking to each other. 

Pretty standard prices for SF bars, $6 for Guiness on tap. Not too bad, but not sure I was thrilled about the atmosphere. May come back again some time, but we'll see. 

Oh, interesting decorations though. I especially liked the Janis Joplin iconography.
author: Rowena L.

description:
Hello bar!
Yeah, alright.
It's a saloon looking bar on Polk Street with average drinks at average prices. Sometimes there are sexy people here but not always.
There are TVs for ports watching.
There's a pool table in back for sporting.
They serve food sometimes.
There's a juke box

You can have fun here!
author: Alexander R.

description:
Love this place! My friend and I were on a search for a young crowd, but not too kiddish or creepy. Avergae pricing, and a lit up dance floor (very small) in the back.
