The bouncer told us to go to the back bar past the dance floor to get drinks because it was way faster, and it definitely is. No wait time at all and friendly bartenders.

Multiple groups of guys come alone here, so of course the usual cheesy pick up line and ass grabbing is a given. Can be trashy groups at times, but overall crowded and a good time. Easy to get in, no wait or cover as well. I'd be back!
author: Leigh K.

description:
Big, chill bar on Polk street. 

I like Polk street, but I don't like crowds and douchebags. McTeagues is a great place to just hang out with nice and chill people. Bartenders are friendly & drinks are cheap. 

You can watch football here (I mean the real football, where the players use their feet to advance the play, hence the name "football") even in the very early mornings as long as it's an EPL game or a World Cup/Euro Cup game (just make sure to double check prior to arriving here at 4am, as they do have their favorite and not-so-favorite teams, so sometimes they wouldn't want to open that early in the morning). 

Yes, I like this place, I like the people and I like the drinks.
author: Helen D.

description: RACIST TO THE CORE!!! I would give a zero if possible. Some woman complained to the bouncer that we were shouting in her ear during a freaking WARRIORS final game and the bouncers kicked out my  friend and said "she is a regular stay away from her" . I have never experienced such racist and preferential treatment in my life every in SF. But this freaking place crossed all its limit. TRUST ME StAY AWaY FROM THIS BAR IF U R A PERSON OF COLOR . I still cannot fathom the shit they did to my friends.
author: Ripple K.

description:
My friends wanted to go bar hopping on a Friday night and we found a perfect bar for our first stop of the night! McTeague's! I have never been to this place before, since I am rarely on this part of the city so I didn't know what to expect! 

Line was pretty long at 11 o'clock and we instantly thought we weren't gonna be able to get in! Lucky us the line moved fast and we were inside within twenty minutes!  It's pretty big inside! and the bar on the left was BUSY, but ordering drinks here was a breeze and $7 for a shot of Jameson?!?! Keep 'em comin!!! 

Most of the bartenders were extremely nice and generous, except for one girl who had an attitude towards a couple of my friends over a small misunderstanding about the drinks. I didn't get her name, but she was obviously giving my friends the stank eye from the other side of the bar. The bartenders in the back of the bar were nice and we got drinks there instead. We'd rather have our money and our tip go to people who deserve it :)

Overall, we liked this place! Huge bar area & there are plenty of tables on the other side. Music was also a mix of different genres to cater to the very mix and diverse crowd here! 4/5 for McTeague's!
author: Glenn L.

description:
When I went last night (Friday) it was too crowded and there the male:female ratio was pretty terrible, like 10:1. Maybe on a regular weekday, the place is spacious like lots of people are saying.

I liked the interior design and the random western props around the joint. I thought it was going to be more of an Irish pub but it seemed more western.

Polk street is kinda weak compared to other streets like Mission St.
author: Marlon T.

description: Open on Christmas Day kind of a mixed crowd, overall not bad. Even thooo it's in the TL!
author: Robert O.
Valeria R.

description: This place is always fun to go to for a fun night out with your friends if you wanna go drinking and dancing. Service at the bar is generally quick. It's a pretty young crowd, looks like mostly college students, and generally more guys than girls on the weekend.
author: Cat M.

description: Oh McTeagues, with your crap mash ups and poorly placed soap dispensers, I am rooting for you. You are one of the the last douche-free zones on Polk.  Your watered down Bushmills must be exactly what my parents used to enjoy after my high school self had at their liquor cabinet. Yay Karma!
author: Delilah P.

description:
Stopped by McTeagues for football on Sunday. They had a bunch of TV's with a different game on each one. The place was not overly crowded, there was a seat for just about everyone in the bar. 

To snack on we ordered the pulled pork nachos. They were really good, piled high with pork, cheese, salsa, sour cream, and fresh avocado. I would defiantly come back here for Sunday football.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I saw a lot of McCrunk things happen in this place, but the Shiner Dark made it all ok. 

This little Nob Hill bar is sort of a cross between a dive and a sports bar. They have a bunch of Texas beers on tap, which made a few of the Texans in our group more than happy. The dark environs made our fairly intoxicated group feel quite comfortable, and the interwebs-juke offered a bumpin' selection of songs, keeping the music-minded at bay. 

Overall, it's a place I could definitely pop into again on a bar crawl. A McDrunken bar crawl.
author: Don B.

description:
What's a night of drinking on Polk St. without a stop at McTeague's for a pint of Guinness and a game of pool?

If you're looking for a laid back pub with tons of room, pool, and great beers on tap , then this is your spot. The bar here is huge, which makes getting a drink quick and easy. 

When you need a change of pace from the hipster dive bars that line Polk head to  McTeague's for a little Irish hospitality.
author: Tom L.

description:
Good drink prices.

Lots of HD Screens for sports.

Dog friendly.

Definitely supports SF Teams.
author: Steven F.

description: And not just for Monday Night Football either! They hook up the free BBQ during Sunday games as well! Forget just the 99%, this is a deal 100% of the population can get behind!
author: Ruggy J.

description: Just One sentence: If you want to enjoy your Friday (you know what I mean) ... go there!
author: Reza T.

description:
Came here after a work event with a friend and must admit the service sucked.  One of the waitresses was taking shots with customers a table over from me, while our actual waitress was nowhere to be seen (probably Miley Cyrus twerking in the back). 
 After fifteen minutes of waiting I decided to order drinks from the bar.  Let's not forget the fact that it wasn't busy! The cool waitress who rips shots with customers didn't even ask us if we were being waited on--not a shocker.  When I asked the bartender if it's normal that the staff drinks on the job he responded "yes".  That's good to know?
The atmosphere wasn't bad though, normal diverse crowd, but the wait staff brings the place down.  Motto of this bar should be 
Good luck to the owners!
author: John L.

description:
Watched the NFL Divisional Round Playoffs here and it was a great time. The bartender moved a table without us even asking. The place got crazy but the bartenders did a good job. I would suggest either pulling the barstools away from the bar to alleviate congestion or adding a few more bartenders. That S.F game was pretty nutty.

I am dinging them a star however because of the food. It was quite possibly the worst food I have ever had. The chicken wings were by far the WORST wings I have ever had. They tasted like wings out of a microwave or something that Papa John's would deliver. I will definitely return on my next visit to SD but I will be sure to eat before going in.
author: Jack L.

description:
Some dead celebrities on the ceiling, some complimentary BBQ ribs on the collapsable table near the door, and Shiner Bock on special 24/7. That is what makes McTeague's a righteous saloon. 

While it's mostly a destination for catching a football game, I actually respect it as a bar beyond just sports. The booths in the back are cozy and the bartenders ain't nosy. Throw on some NFL action and everyone is high fiving and smiling away. 

I'd take an hour or so here any day.
author: Jane K.

description: Be careful- two of my friends have had their iPhones pick-pocketed here on different nights. According to other reviews, it's happened quite a few times before. Security suggests you "wear your purse in front of you". I won't be going back.
author: Elyse L.

description: The drink selection is not great, but there's usually a good vibe here.  Lots of space to stand around and chat, and barrels to put your drinks on.  Came here for my birthday and they have this wicked colourful tile floor in the back that we ended up playing impromptu adult Twister on.  Good times!
author: Letitia L.

description:
I like it Southern Style sometimes, but any day is a Shiner Bock day.


That's right. On tap.

Getty-up N' Yee-haw.

After that, get your people watchin' eyes out and shake it a bit on the floor cuz this place is PRIME for both.
author: Jessica R.

description: Fun bar with good staff. The 2 buck lonestar and country music on Thursday draws a nice crowd.  Not bad for sports on the weekend.  I agree its one of the last douche free zones on Polk.
author: Todd F.

description:
Divey yet generally solid Irish / Texas bar on lower Polk in Tendernob.  Can become too much of a mob scene for me at times on weekends, but overall respectable joint.

The good:
1- cheap drinks
2- around a lot of other places (good location for barhopping / pub crawl)
3- shiner bock
4- has an "Alex Smith #11 Sucks" sign up at the bar
5- closest thing in the bay area to Texas for Longhorn football watching
6- near my house (file under: things of great importance to you)

The bad: 
7- can develop a slightly bro-on-the-prowl creeper vibe on weekend nights (Marina lite, I'll call it...)
8- despite being a decently big place, it fills up (I guess this is both a pro and a con) and can get super crowded, almost overwhelmingly so
9- like most places on Polk, McTeagues has like a 5:1 guy:girl ratio.  While you'd think this would be a plus for me, please see #7 above.
10- $15 bar tab minimum, which at the McTeagues prices, you may or may not be able to meet
author: Molly B.

description: For a dive bar, which I am not too big a fan of, I thought this place was pretty cool. They do NOT serve any food but you are more than welcome to bring food in. You can buy pitchers of beer and watch a game but they also have a seperate room so its not all about sports. I thought this place was pretty cool. Happy I went.
author: Brittini S.

description: This is a real old school sports bar for real sports fans. No (or at least not as many) poseurs here. Deceptively large with a lot of booths for you and your small group of cronies. Bouncers are nice and cool but do their job of keeping the peace and the waitresses here get it done -- they are able to keep it together in the largest of packed crowds and get you plenty to drink in record time (relative to other sports bars during a major event). Lots of staff to keep your tables clear of used glasses and trash. I like the oldish wood interiors and eclectic decor. And I love it that the bartender was able to make me a proper Manhattan with a brandied cherry that I ordered on a whim vs. the usual beer on tap.
author: Kate A.

description: Wife and I had a great experience this past Saturday.  We are in our forties so on the older side of the crowd but lots of fun people in the room.  The staff was over the top kind and very attentive.  We went to 4 other places in the area and all were OK but McTeague's was our absolute favorite and a big part of what we will remember from our trip to San Francisco
author: Julie S.

description:
I knew I was going to like this place. I took a class at SF State called History of San Francisco, and we had to read the book, "McTeague". I fell in love with the book and when I walked past this bar I thought "I MUST GO HERE!!!!

It's a lot bigger inside that I thought. Plenty of seating is always good! There was also an electronic juke box which made me a happy girl. They don't really specialize in fancy cocktails, so don't try to order one. My dumb ass asked the bar tender to make me something creative with vodka and she said "Um, we're pretty much a beer and whiskey kind of bar." And my boyfriend made the "haha, my girlfriend is kind of a ding bat" laugh. Oopsie. The bartender was a good sport and made me a cocktail that was pretty good. 

For our second round, our bartender was this dude with a voice like Macho Man Randy Savage. He was freakin awesome. I asked him if he had read the book, "McTeague," and he said he tried but someone stole the book from the bar. I plan on going back and giving him a copy. Anyways, he made me a strong drink and I liked him. He was nice, even though he looked like he could kick my ass.

So yeah, McTeague's was cool. I would probably go here with my beer drinking friends and not my vodka drinking friends though.
author: Liz M.

description:
Thursdays is country night
line dancing lessions they say they start at 7pm its more like 8.30pm
not great teaching it lasts for less than 10 minutes,hard to follow
its a fun night ,spontenous line dancing breaks out every 20 minutes after teacher is gone,who knows what steps people are doing,
its at the back bar
beer specials 2-3 beers $2 see the sign outside the bar,bar staff at front a bit slow

friendly bar man at back,quick service,
watch a few youtube videos before you go,so you will be an expert line dancer 
they had hot dogs $3
fun Thursday night,lone star beer $2,chumba beer not in stock,and dos equis$2
ment to have $1 tachos but not in stock,
look for coffin on ceiling,in front bar
lots of tv screens in front bar
author: cc c.

description:
To preface, I lived in Austin, went to UT and therefore bleed burnt orange. And barring a horrific experience, I will support any establishment that does the same. That said, my love for McTeagues extends beyond the Longhorn camaraderie: 

Pros
- Shiner on draft, Shiner black (or blonde in the summer) and Lone Star--all of which are on special during football games
- Super chill vibe most of the time...a great place to settle in, have a couple of drinks and catch a game
- Bartenders are always nice; not always looking to chat you up, but timely in taking drink orders 
- Solid BBQ and other food on Mondays and for special events

Cons
- It can get a little nuts at night on the weekends...and it's a pain to stand in line.
author: Jenn G.

description: I really liked the inside when I went here. A lot of space, eclectic decour. It had a very strange quality to it, especially with the big golden teeth. But the bartender was drunk and didn't seem to know how to make a drink. The service was just pretty poor. Maybe I'll give it another chance on a busier night. That's when it seems to thrive according to reviews, but my first impression wasn't a good one.
author: Dexter H.

description:
Well! It was nice to look up and see Kurt Cobain waving from his coffin on the ceiling. So 4 stars for the right there, and for a $4 pint of Sierra Nevada, though it wasn't the best tasting Sierra I've had pulled from a tap. 

The barkeeps were lovely and the interior is nice and spacious, and even though they took an existing nothing of a space and sprayed a can of "YeOldeMcOlde" on it, it is somehow not too bothersome.
author: Gwynnie P.

description: Unique interior that speaks the word "fun"! Although it looks small from the outside, this place is fairly big and is a great place for a group gathering. The last time I was at the bar was on a Friday night after work (around 8pm), and there was hardly anyone inside. Perhaps too early?
author: Amy M.

description:
McTeague's is the place to be for US national team soccer matches in SF. They put the matches on pretty much all their TVs with sound, the bartenders respect and love the fans (as opposed to those that treat US soccer as an afterthought or hassle), and they ring their bell whenever we score!

They have tons of room, reasonable prices, and it makes for a great atmosphere to watch our teams play.
author: Casey P.

description:
My friends and I stumbled upon this place walking along Polk. It was late afternoon on a Saturday and we wanted somewhere to hang out before dinner. First impression: they made strong, cheap drinks! I had a cranberry vodka and a Long Island while my friends enjoyed a few draft beers. Our bill for six drinks came out to about $30. A budget-friendly bar!

The bar had a good vibe, too. Crowd was mixed and everyone was pretty chill. I liked the "old San Francisco" feel with the decor.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Finally found a legit sports bar in San Francisco!

I randomly stumbled into this place on a Saturday afternoon because my boyfriend was looking for a sports bar to watch college football and McTeague's definitely delivered!

There are multiple HD-TV's and the bar tender was very accommodating and gladly changed the games on each TV based on what people wanted to see. 

The reason this place is getting 5 stars is because of Jesus' BBQ! McTeague's offers donation-based BBQ prepared by Jesus (their chef) that is simply delicious! Be sure to tip to Jesus! He's the man!
author: Martha N.

description:
I'm not knocking this place in any way- it was an adequate stop in our Friday night barhop. But nothing stood out as being special- no good music, no great drink specials, etc.

I realized I forgot my ID while in line and explained to the bouncer. (I'm clearly over 21 and the man I was with had his ID, and was too.) The bouncer was definitely curt about it, and I had to take a cab back to Hayes Valley to get my ID. (We were meeting my sis in law there) 

They recognized me when I got back in line....for my trouble, they could've kicked me a free drink or something, but no. :/

I wouldn't return, honestly. Very loud, noisy, crowded, can't walk type of place.
author: Ashley P.

description:
I love McTeague's!

How much?  Yesterday I drunk texted my friend and thanked him for introducing me to the bar.  I don't think I've ever done that before in my life.  He was extremely confused and asked how drunk I was.

Thursday Night:
Pretty empty.  They closed off the back room due to the lack of patrons.  Plenty of available booths/ seating to the side.  No cover.

Friday Night:
So crowded there's barely room to walk.  Is this seriously the same bar?  I don't think I've ever been to a bar THIS crowded.  Still no cover!  Back room is open and there's apparently even a place where the floor lights up in multi-colored blocks.

FRIDAY WINS!  (Play Rebecca Black song "Friday" here.  And down that jager bomb like a champ.)
author: Fei L.

description:
Me: "do you have the big ten channel on satellite?" 

Them: " Yes dear and we have your vodka tonic and bathrobe waiting at the bar with your pipe" 

Me: "Are you showing the Purdue game?" 

Them: "Of course master and we have all of the Irish playmates that you pre selected in the ball cage lubed up with raspberry as per your instructions" 

Me: " I asked for Brazilians 

Them: "fixed, oh and the donkey did not agree with the price you quoted" 

Me: "Oh well, at least tell me that JuJaun is starting center" 

Them: "Leads the league in scoring he does sir" 

Not sure where we are going with this but I wasn't wrong about the Dutch in the world cup and I promise you will see the Boilers in the final 8 at least. 

I asked them if I could "Boiler up" and they conceded. Not many places that will do that for you.
author: Dru P.

description:
Lone Star in California?  SOLD!  Well, almost. 

This is any bar U.S.A..  Great pub-relaxed atmosphere.  Big bar, considering its location.  Lots of T.V.s to catch a game.  They also stream Netflix, and sometimes when the bartenders are feeling friendly, will take requests. 

Pool tables, bar music...you know the drill.  Good first stop for a night of bar hopping.  But I wouldn't write home to mom about it.
author: Claire G.

description:
McTeague's is a great place to grab a high ball after work. 

I like the classic interior. A nice sturdy wood bar, pool table, plenty of comfortable space. It's a great place to go with friends. If you're alone or in the mood for mingling it's good for that too. The crowd is usually a good mix of ages and types so, whoever you are, you will likely strike up a conversation with someone cool. 

I drink cocktails with club soda and I've been poured countless flat drinks, but I've never gotten a flat drink here, so the drinks are great too. 

Cheers McTeague's!
author: Slim P.

description:
The Polk St. version of Kels Irish Bar for me and my friends.  Maybe a little more mellow because of the lack of dancing...

Good moderate priced bar you can find yourself in on Saturday in jeans, but still dress up in heels in you feel like it.   Can get pretty crowded, and its always a guarantee you will make some new friends.
author: Cassie B.

description:
I came here on Friday night to buy my darling Phil a beer, and am glad to add it to my list of "Places on Polk."  Oh, I didn't make that list yet?  No matter, because I will.  

This would be a great place to have some sort of I-spy game at it (done after consuming one of their many beers and doing some shots- at happy hour prices, of course).  I spied a skeleton, lots of pretty bottles, cozy booths, a pool table, good crowd, a nice bartender, an ATM, and...a few other things that I'm not going to reveal because it would ruin my chances of beating you next time we come here.

What I did NOT spy was a kitchen, despite the fact that they had food items on the menu.  When I heard a telltale "ding,"  I figured that must be it.  

Not a bad place, and I believe they take plastic which is a bonus for me as I never carry around cash.  I heard some people had some trouble with the in/out door, but that tends to happen when people are drinking.

I will probably be back...someday.
author: Pam S.

description:
If you want to be treated like you're in Vegas, come to this shithole. And by that, I don't mean treated like a high roller, I mean treated like a talking wallet. 

If you want to hang out in a crowded hallway filled with people, go to McTeagues. 

If you want to have the lights turned on at 1:20, this is your spot. I was moved from one end of the bar to the other a HALF AN HOUR before last call. All I wanted to do was finish the beer that I paid for, wasn't making a fuss, wasn't beligerent. It was me and my girlfriend in a booth finishing our very full drinks. Some dickhead tells us to put our drinks down and leave. I look at my watch and he says,"don't look at your watch, get movin'." 

I've been here a few times and every time has been mediocre. The place has no vibe, good or bad, looks like shit and is too crowded.

Oh, did I mention that they charged a cover and then pushed everyone out 10 minutes later? What a fucking scam. 

Mediocre everything, over priced. Honestly, they've fooled me enough times.
author: Jay C.

description: Ay me lads, Howerya on tis fine day?? Lemme give ye the craic on this place. I was brought along with my boyfriend and his cousin for their coworker's going away job celebration. It wasn't what I expected, not like your average bar. This seems like a place where you can unwind and just have a drink or so. I thought there'd be dancing but there wasn't anyone dancing...well my boyfriend danced anyways trying to get me to dance too, thought he was cute that night for doing so. We also saw a group of people bringing in their own pizza...if I'd known better I'd bring my own food too.
author: Tina L.

description:
I've had mellow happy hours here (my favorite), I've had not-so-mellow raging good times here with dozens of new best friends, multiple shots, cocktails and pitchers of high quality beer...it's a cavernous space, great for large groups with strong drinks for cheap (my go-to drinks are almost always lighter in color than most places and it's definitely not due to extra ice), and it's also just a nice spot to chill after work.  It can get really crowded at times, but I've never felt claustrophobic when it is.  

Entertaining decor on the ceiling, great music selection (whoever played the bluegrass version of "Gin and Juice" during a commercial in Game 1 of the World Series here, I salute you) and they even have food now - everytime I go here, I find something new to rave about.
author: Sus... B.

description: Just came in and loving it. It is 4pm on a Thursday, I am working thanks to free Wifi surrounded by great music, lovely environment, and lovely bartenders:)
author: Duygu G.

description:
Stepping into this bar felt like I was traveling back in time to a frat party.  The place was packed and I was served beer in a plastic cup.  That may have had something to do with a 49ers game, but I suspect not.  This is not a place to kick back for a casual conversation but rather to get loaded and eventually have someone in your group puke and be escorted out.  I'm sure that's the MO of a lot of folks there.

This would be a stop on a bar crawl but not a final destination.

(Maybe I am just getting too old for this scene.)
author: Marcin M.

description:
8 bucks for a shot of JB and a tap beer? That's not good. You know why? Because for a chill 40 bucks, you've got 5 beers and 5 shots. 

If you can take that, you belong at AA, not McTeagues. 

The rustic interior has so much western influence that screams like a first generation Chinese born in Walnut Creek: Am I White or am I Chinese?! I'm so confused!

But, it's more of a "Am I Irish or am I Texan?" It sort of feels like "I really don't belong in SF." Then you see the red lighting everywhere and it looks like a scene out of a vampire movie http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/Iv8htFzevvuRaHKfcEGq6Q/l

So what it is, McTeagues? Irish, PWT, and into dark magic?

The bathrooms, however, are incredibly clean and the atmosphere is very chill. The dead celebrity/hippy coffin drawings on the ceiling are fun to stare at http://static.px.yelp.com/bphoto/NLqGSBzTuUDjZA9UTyhI1Q/l and the bartenders are good conversationalists. I love the solo pool table that hogs the spotlight in the rear.

My verdict is to use this place like a brothel... It's good the moment but there's better elsewhere.
author: Jason C.

description:
I first found out about McTeague's when one of the owners emailed me to reach out on behalf of the bar to offer to host an event for the Texas Exes, my alumni group.  I decided to check the bar out to see what it could offer, as our current game-watching location (Blue Light) was offering us nothing except a convenient place to watch our games.

Upon walking into McTeague's, I found a very spacious spot with comfortable surroundings.  The place is Irish & Texas-themed, as one owner is Irish and the other is Texan.  I got to chat with Chris (the Texan owner) and found out he wanted the bar to be a home for us Texas Exes.  The bar had a lot going for it: Texas decor in the back room, Shiner Bock and Shiner Black on tap, and 2 smokers to cook up some BBQ.

We decided to hold our Christmas party at the bar to test it out.  Chris cooked up BBQ for our group that was pretty tasty... and yes, it was really Texas-style BBQ, not that crap California-style stuff.  Everyone who attended liked the space, the food, and the drinks.  There was a decent crowd, but there was plenty of room to walk around and mingle, unlike in Blue Light where you get packed in like sardines and struggle to get a drink.

Overall, I love the spot and plan on having future Texas Exes events there.  It's also in a nice up-and-coming area on Lower Polk.  Chris is laid-back and really easy to work with.  I also hear they do free BBQ on college football game days.  Next year, they are planning on adding another couple of TVs during football season.

Thanks, McTeague's!
author: Kenny L.

description: Had a pubcrawl here with friends for a charity.  They kicked me out because I had a money bucket in my hand.  I used to like this bar, but their managers are pricks and I will never give them another dollar.
author: Becky S.

description:
I always skip over this place in favor of the Hemlock down the street, but since the Hemlock got rid of its pool table, the place just isn't the same. So we hopped on over here to shoot, and I was impressed. Aside from having a pool table, the bar itself is spacious and I love the open floor contrasted with the intimate booth seating.

Got a vodka cran and it was $5 and tasted like cranberry juice. Eek! I asked the bartender (a guy whose name I forget but who was rad regardless) if he could spruce it up a bit, which he did gladly. In fact, after a few more sips, I had to request more juice to even it out. 

My friend left his glasses here on accident, and when we called, they found them and set them aside. What great people! I'm sold.
author: Natalye R.

description:
yess i've been looking for a place that reminds me of pb bars in san diego!!

finally finally finally.  i went out polk st for the very first time over the weekend and this was our second stop.  i went with two of my friends and saw some friends inside...

one of my friends was in crutches and heels + we weren't wearing much because we had just left manor west = a lot of attention from random people...

but you know how girls are.  we didn't really want to talk to anyone else... so what did we do??  tried to convince anyone who talked to us that we were crazy...

by obsessively talking about fraiser... except it backfired because this one guy loved fraiser.

okay this is weird.  it was just a humorous night because we had this little game going on so i was laughing a lot.  

more about mcteague's itself... no cover to get in.  there was a line, but it was pretty fast because people were coming in and out.  bouncer was nice and so were the bartenders.  they were fast -- yay!  there's $15 minimum on cards though :(

butttt my birthday is this weekend and i think i want to head over to polk for some day drinking (:  maybe start here.  or end here.  or just stay here.
author: Jennifer L.

description: My friend had her iphone stolen there. The security did absolutely NOTHING to help out even though we pointed out the theft. By the time they reacted the thief had reached the streets and the security said they can no longer do anything. The management should do something about this. Ridiculous!!!
author: Deniz A.

description:
This is one hot spot to visit if you are bar hopping on Polk St.

Drinks are cheap, strong and it's always super packed on Thursday or Friday nights!

The bartenders here are nice and super generous, so tip them well! 

We never have a boring time when we visit McTeague's!
author: Christina T.

description: There is something really sketchy going on at this bar. My friends and I came in here for no more than 10 minutes. I myself was completely sober. I had my I phone stolen right out of my purse, and a few days later received a call from my bank that there were fraudulent charges on my credit card. This was the last place I used my card. I tried to talk to management and was told "Sorry your phone was stolen" then they proceeded to kick me out. I got upset and tried to talk to the bouncer and he was laughing "Girl your phone got jacked you can't come back inside".... All I am saying is avoid coming here if you care about your belongings!
author: Hanna D.

description:
Salute to McTeague for the best time (to drink) and for the worst time (to get kicked out).

This is my usual hangout bar after work. You can't complain about this place at all - a pool table, tv's, BEERS and LIQUORS. Of course the fun hangout moments. Good times.
author: Edmund L.

description:
I asked for a Jameson and coke. I got a shit ton of Jameson and a little coke. For 6 bucks. Instead of the usual 8. UHM I'm a happy girl.

The bartenders are fun. And funny. I love to flirt with them. I love their kick ass attitude. I love watching the cute scene boys play poool. And I love meeting people here.

I can easily stumble my way home. Plus.
author: Amanda S.

description:
San Francisco Bars!

CLEANLINESS: 4/5
SERVICE: 4/5
DRINKS: N/A

Came here one night with a group of friends. This place was packed! The atmosphere was cool. I didn't expect much from the bars here in San Francisco, but this place was pretty cool. Although there were a lot of people, you can still breathe inside and it wasn't so hot either. They also have some table seating, which is nice.
author: Desmond C.

description: If you're in your 20s, this is far and away the most happening bar in the city.  I've had consistently great Friday and Saturday nights here all summer.
author: Augman L.

description: Wonderful place. Big size , nice people and music. I usually walk the place to its other end, I kept walking and there was always another area, dance floor, another area and finally some nice couches and tables towards the end. Will visit there more often.
author: Neeraj A.

description: The place has a pretty cool aesthetic but is way too loud. Also, their drinks are weak and overpriced. I don't mind a packed bar, but the acoustics of the place made the noise unbearable. What's more, the layout makes it really hard to maneuver when the place is full. In the main area they have a step up to a row of booths. They have a bannister along the step, 3 feet from the booths. If you sit down here, when its crowded, you will shortly have people standing immediately next to you doing an awkward butt shake at face level. Forget about trying to maneuver your way back to the bar, you have to navigate the shoulder-to-shoulder people and the bizarrely placed  and oddly long bannister. This place might be nice if you're looking for a drink on a Tuesday afternoon or something, but on Saturday night it's hell.
author: Theresa S.

description:
It's a good sports bar with lots of HDTVs. Too many dudes, though. It's big, but it's mostly open floor space (and not a dance floor). There's a second bar and some booths in the back, which is nice, but there's no smoking room.

5:1 Guy:Girl Ratio + Lack of smoking room (I'm gross, I know) = -1 star. Other than that, a great place.
author: Eliot R.

description:
Wow, has this place gotten popular! Lately the lines outside are just insane. My friends and I decided to go last Saturday night after a dinner and we had not been in months. It has a good ratio of men: women, only I saw way more women this time. As you walk in, it looks like your typical saloon, no you will not see fur trappers, cowboys, soldiers, gold prospectors, miners,  gamblers, or rango. You will see people actually pretty dressed up for this place.

It's always full to where you bump into everyone, and hard to get to the bar area to order a drink. There are booths on the sides and has the western feel to it. There is a separate room in the back with another bar and you have to walk though a mini hallway where guys usually stand against the wall like hawks to see all the women pass by or the occasional couple who I just want to tell them, Dear couple intensely making out in my way, get a room, tsk, tsk. If you look closely at in the back there are more hidden booths. 

I always have a good time here, theres only a juke box, which is good, but if you want more upbeat it's not the place to go for dancing. The prices are reasonable, last time I bought my friend a beer and I had a vodka tonic and it came out to be $10. So we proceeded with shot, shots, shots, shots and started to speak in another language, loudly, and that's when we knew we had too many. The drinks here are a million times better than at Mayes next door and there is no cover. 

I met the owner the other day and asked him why they do last call at 1:15am, and he says because it is too full and the cops pass by. Everyone was kicked out by 1:45am, uber lame. Rewind, 30 min before, there was this douche who had a champagne bottle and starting dancing champagne showers and got all of us soaked. Thank you big and scary bouncers for kicking him out, much appreciated!
author: Stephanie M.

description: Shots of tequila are generally always a bad idea.  Thank goodness for Henny.  That sugar makes the medicine go down...  Quick service... 20-something crowd (why AM I HERE, AGAIN?)....dark...lots of teles (can always catch some Texas game...).  This place is A - IGHT.
author: Hiromi N.

description: This place is really cool, fast drinks, friendly bartenders, lots of TVs and places to sit.  The fellow drinkers are affable and into sports as well.  I think they serve food here also but they didn't mind when I brought my own sandwich in and ate it at one of their barrels (lol, they have barrels set up as tables to add table space without taking up a lot of room).  This is a very comfortable bar with lots of good people to drink with and watch games at.  I'd bring my mom here.
author: Brandon E.

description: Stopped in there this Saturday noon to grab a couple cheap brews based on reviews. Cool atmosphere but the bartender charged me $3 for a $2 Lone Star and looked at me weird when I didn't tip him due to the forementioned. I didn't bother sticking around for long after that.
author: Nate C.

description: I can't say enough great things about McTeagues.  It has become my go to place in SF for drinks and to watch games.   They are now showing the Sharks playoff games with sound as well.  Management and the owner are terrific and very accommodating as well.
author: Lara M.

description: A nice, chill bar on Polk and usually standing room only -- a good place to grab a few beers but on a Friday night was tough to hear my friends -- so, not the best spot if you want to have a pretty consistent conversation.  Otherwise, the feel of the place is pretty good, and although it was crowded, it still didn't feel thaaaaat crowded.  A-ok.
author: Mel G.

description: I went here Saturday night.  I generally don't go to bars this far from home (about a 10 minute cab ride) but the girls wanted to go.  Turned out to be awesome.  Somewhat packed but not like you're bumping elbows with people.  Lots of great Halloween costumes spotted as well.  Good drink specials, everybody had a great time, and the bar layout is great - it is wide enough that you can actually see across the room, talk to other people and easily get up to the bar.  Will go back again.
author: Scott H.

description:
Definitely a decent dive bar on Polk. STRONG drinks, cheap beers, dim lighting, and that smell of a bar we all love. A good place to watch games when other places are slammed too. I never decide to come here but also don't mind when friends suggest it. 

They also have a cool set of paintings that show dead people standing above coffins on the ceiling such as Kurt Kobain, Jimmy Hendrix etc.. so look up next time you are there!
author: Mike K.

description: Man, my head has been way up my ass to not stumble across this place until now. Really cool bar! Reminds me of any countless bars in the East Village/ 3rd Avenue in Manhattan. It wasn't very busy for a Friday, but I hear that Fridays in the city aren't what they used to be. Whatever.  Definitely coming back here during college football next year...
author: Jim B.

description:
Really my favorite bar in SF...When I first moved to SF three years ago this was my spot since I lived in Nob Hill--Great for watching sporting events, late night drinking...everything.

Why did I wait this long to write this review? Well because last night I went again and remembered why it is my favorite bar. First, I asked them to change one of the tv's to a volleyball game I wanted to and they did right away without giving me a hard time.

Then, it was my friends birthday and they made sure to help us order a specialty shot for her to enjoy.

We were there earlier (7-9) and it was easy for us to enjoy be around the tv and for us to enjoy watching the game.

Although late night (10:30-11PM) the place will start to get really crowded and is not really my scene (I enjoy chill places where you can sit and enjoy beer and whisky). Overall this is a great place to be anytime during the day/for watching a game. Or if you want a fun packed night.
author: Jon W.

description: if you wanna brodown it doesn't get better than mcteagues. unfortunately the aforementioned broing down doesn't really do it for me any more. It's pretty crowded there too despite it's cavernous size.
author: Misha T.

description:
Plus another star for happy hour being from 12-7pm...

$3 mimosas and $3 Guiness? What????? Amazing.

-1 star for not having a back patio.  It does get pretty dark in there.
author: Jenny W.

description:
Pushy crowds, frat-tastic flirts, and angry drunken girls who threatened me in the bathroom because I apparently took too long. As in, tried to break in and hit me. It was difficult to have a normal, even civil, conversation. The highlight of my experience was getting a seat at the bar (which almost got hijacked by a lone middle aged man) with my friend, and chatting it up with the door guy while waiting for our other friends to enter.

This was an evening in the life of me when I ventured to McTeague's the other night. I've been here for St. Patrick's Day, random weeknights, and the busy Friday or Saturday... it's always seems busy, which is good. The bartenders are cool, but geez... I get panic attacks and can't stand being crowded. The crowd on said Friday night was particularly unruly, and as a rule of thumb, I dislike any small-ish bar with a line (and believe me, I wouldn't have come if it was this busy upon entering).
author: Kristin F.

description:
this place is frekain awesome!!!
I gotta say they have freakin' great specials on Saturdays (for college football, and continue onto the night) 
that, and i don't know if its a "TEXAS bar" but i was there for the UT v. T-Tech game ... yeah the one where they lost in the last second, and the safety jumped the route... yada, yada, yada.... 

anyway, it was pretty dead at the time, but in the evenings, it gets pretty busy.  decent TV's, i think they have ~5, and one was set to pig-hunting (interestingly enough)

overall, i love this place because its a good balance between a place where i can go and chill and watch the game, but also can go and stay out all night there too!
author: Ken T.

description: 2 dollar lone stars!  Can't complain there. Bar has a cult texans following. Get ready for some football!
author: Tommy A.

description: Regular pub with tacky stuff on the walls nothing too special about it.  It has nice booths.
author: Matthew P.

description: I like this place, it usually has a good crowd and good beer. Today I thought the beer wasn't cold enough. Trumer Pils and Stella were served a tad too warm for my taste. Some beers may be better at 45 degrees, but not these IMO.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Friendly bartenders. Great and roomy setup. Wide and quality draft beer selection including Batch 19 and Shiner Boch.

Lone Star State of Mind: If you're a Texan missing Texas music or just a fan of Texas music, this is your place. Big supporter of University of Texas sports - not a big deal for me, but good to know. $2 Lone Star.
author: Emily C.

description:
If your looking for a good bar for your Polk Street "Let's Get Drunk and Regret What We Did" Crawl between Red Devil Lounge and your final stop, Lush... McTeague's is the place to go. 

It was 9PM when we rolled in - expecting to chill - there was about a trillion people there (really...a trillion)...no dancing really...just strictly standing room only drinking. Although, I did see some booths, all of them were filled up super early on for a Saturday night.

There seems to be some noticeable favoring there tho...I ordered the same drink as my friend...and, although I didn't mind AT ALL, there was like 5 times the vodka in mine than hers.

Juke Box was filled with oldies and goodies...no real top 40 madness which is nice and refreshing when you know just one block away you can get your top 40 groove on at Veritgo. 

Also has darts and one pool table for the gamers in a separated room from the main area.
author: Katy A.

description:
This place is crowded as hell on the weekend. The bartenders, Curtis in particular... gods. All of them. The place was just remodeled in the back and looks FANTASTIC! 

Big selection of beers, tons of hard liquor, good prices, awesome music. What more could you ask for!?
author: Taylor S.

description:
I came to this pub hoping to find an atmosphere reflecting that of the book. The large tooth outside of the bar was promising, but inside, there were no distinguishing factors from the novel or movie. 

The interior is spacious, and tastefully decorated as an Irish pub/ saloon. Disappointingly, they did not serve Anchor Steam beer, but they do have pitchers of beer for $12. While I was inside of McTeague's, I heard the bartender kick out two people for not having an ID, and that may be one of the reasons why the bar was so empty.
author: Emily B.

description: It's in a great spot on Polk, the drinks are decently priced, there's no cover charge - but good goddamn is it crowded. If you try to go in any day except M-F, they'll have bouncers at the door and a line down the block. It's a college spot, so beware. Other than that, it's amazing! Very cozy and the regulars are friendly.
author: Cecilia A.

description:
I am here so often I have to give this place 5 stars

Great location near tons of other bars this is my go to bar. Its a great place to meet new people or go with a group of friends. 

Age range: 21 to 28 approx

Its a big place and gets real crowded which makes it fun. Not too hard to get a drink

Thursday to Saturday are the best nights here

No dancing.

Happy hour is also unbeatable
author: James B.

description:
I gotta give this place a serious shout-out.  About as good as it gets in my book.  I haven't been on a Friday or Saturday night, but when my softball team strolls in on Monday nights, they ALWAYS hook it up and are some of the friendliest bartenders I've ever had the pleasure of buying a $2 or $3 LONE STAR from.  Yeah, that's right, Lone Star.  Get some.

As for the ambiance: good amount of TV's with sports on, cool artwork, and laid back pub atmosphere.
author: Matt L.

description:
Came here mid-week with a friend. She is from Texas, went to Texas and  loves Texas. This is the place to go if you need a Texas fix. 

I have to say I was not a Texas fan until after I hung out at McTeague's. That place is the place to go if you are a Texas fan. I believe the owner went to Texas. Any the place is decked out in Texas gear, as well as items that make me think of the west. It is definitely the traditional kind of bar. It is definitely spacious and really cool. 

The beer selection is pretty decent. I was happy they had blue moon on tap, and that seemed to suffice. Their prices are reasonable. There really wasn't a crowd there, but I hear it can get busy on the weekends. Definitely a place I would come back to, to catch a football game or a hockey game.
author: Diana R.

description:
I'm a huge UT fan, which is strange coming from a California girl, so I can appreciate this place a little more than most people.

Stopped in after a few drinks at Hemlock, because McTeague's happens to be one of our friends FAVORITE places ever.  The place was packed, the mood and atmosphere was alright, but I'm gonna go ahead and say I wasn't drunk enough to really enjoy myself here.

The drinks weren't too bad, decent beers on tap, and not too expensive.  The wait at the bar was a little longer than I would have liked, but understandable.  No soap in the girls bathroom left me cringing every time I walked out and back to the bar, and yes the jukebox that night played Tik-Tok three times in less than an hour.  WHO DOES THAT
author: Madison B.

description:
What can I say this place is AWESOME......  Its a friendly local bar that draws 20-30's peeps.  Note:  the best night is hands down Friday night, since peeps come here to drink and mingle versus Saturday which is kind of pre-drinking spot before going to the final destination.  From what I've seen, people usually go here before going to Mayes (next door).   The crowd is really laid back and friendly, some people are dressed up and the rest are in jeans/tees.  They have 1 pool table in the back with several sets with various games on.  Ratios are usually pretty good here, like 50:50, very outgoing crowd, so if your anti-social and need a hardcore dive bar, then this isn't your place.  The crowd is a mix of ex-marina, North beachsters, and Russian Hill peeps... Major bonus since there arent any hipsters (sorry Mission peeps, but try Hemlock which is down the street).   Drinks are moderately priced.  Plus, a major bonus is that it doesnt take 10 hours to get 1 drink (ummmm like some places, I wont name, the hell with it, ex Mayes, lol).   
Overall, cool place if your looking for a fun, mellow crowd, were you can meet new people and down some decent brew..
author: Mike M.

description:
As I'm in here 3+ times/wk, I haven't a clue how this has not been reviewed...

Since I've lived in SF, some of my most memorable nights have happened here...bf asking me to move in, obama's inauguration, bumping into my first bf from FRANCE at the pool table (Wtf?), many a reunion of college friends...

Pool table, booths, huge bar, good barkeeps...McTeagues continues to deliver some of the best times to be had in this town
author: Gabrielle J.

description:
McTeague's makes me McHappy! 

In one week's time I'll have completed my move to The Loin and will officially have inherited McTeague's Saloon as one of my local bars. I couldn't be happier. A far cry from the Bus Stop, this sports bar has large flat screen TV's, a long and spacious bar, and a pool table in the back for all you billiard players (or for people like me who like to play and just make fools out of themselves). The crowd is diverse and friendly.

I'm looking in to my Loin-like crystal ball and I see lot's of beer, sports and fun in my future!

P.S. Holler at me for #300!!! Woooot!
author: Julia N.

description:
Correction:

I have been to McTeague's Saloon 4 times (Thanks Janney...you are a great editor!)

4. Ali's fabulous birthday (so fun Ali!)
author: Angelo F.

description:
A big, gold-painted molar hangs from the outside McTeague's sign and that should have been clue enough for this English major.  However, it's been a long while since I read McTeague by Frank Norris....

So, I've been by McTeague's Saloon many times but never popped in until a rude bartender at Route 66 caused me to look afield.

Bad news first:  Even an hour after opening, and allowing for the TL-redolent air circulating through, the saloon retains an unfortunate (but probably Gold Rush-authentic) spilled liquor and old mop water smell.  But that's the worst of it.

Good news:  The old-timey setting, generous seating, artwork (look up), good range of bar selections, and a courteous bartender willing to mix up a drink as requested left me with a favorable impression (even if it is yet another big sports bar).
author: Poet D.

description:
McTeague's is a downright fun bar and I'm surprised I don't come here more.

Planted on Polk, it rounds out the line of watering holes pretty well on this street. Casual, easy going and basic, but it still has it's own unique feel.

It's a wide space, with a weathered floor and long wood bar that has seen its fair share of tipsy. Those who man the bar are on point as well. It was packed on Friday night as we came to celebrate a friend's Birthday, but we never waited more than a few minutes before we were attended to.

The crowd really makes this place. Down to earth, beer drinking folk, all looking to find the laughs of the night, and find the route that will at some point lead them to a basket of fries at Grubstake.

Drinks are cheap and you don't need to don the designer threads to mingle.

Good times. Very Good Times.
author: Mike K.

description:
Good ole' McTeague's. My bar-of-choice for the first stop (and sometimes last stop) of any Polk Street bar hop. I love the vibe this place has. Amidst a sea of flashier bars typically packed with the type of people that take themselves just a bit too seriously, McTeague's offers solace to thirsty twentysomethings who want nothing more than chill a atmosphere to kick back with friends and enjoy good beer at good prices. Plus, there is often plenty of seating, a lively, young crowd and cups and dice for your occasional drinking game. Overall, McTeague's is a great place to spend a Friday or Saturday night if you're looking for something fun and not too crazy.

The only -1? McTeague's gets very crowded at around 11:30 on weekends, so either come early or come prepared to feel a tad claustrophobic.
author: Joseph F.

description: Awesome place! The bartenders are nice here. The girl bartender didn't charge me the minimum because I didn't know there was one for putting down a card. Dark and homey. Great neighborhood bar. There are TVs, and a pool table. Great happy hour deals. Dog friend too!
author: Katie Anne N.

description: Great cheap drinks. I like blacking out here because I always wake up in a bed that's not in jail, and I always still have my wallet, phone, and keys *knock on wood*.
author: Michael L.

description:
I love love love this bar! it has such a fun environment and the drink prices are very reasonable. 

The only thing is it gets super packed so you should get there early! 
but they have an extra bar in the back so thats pretty convenient.

cash only so stop at an ATM!
author: Victoria G.

description:
Popular bar on Polk St. Its wild on the weekends, but during the day its pretty quiet, and has plenty of tv's to watch sports. Its a cool Irish bar with some Longhorn fans. However, It's a lot different at night on the weekends. The bar is packed on the weekends with twenty and thirty year olds that have not left their college days too far behind them. They are either working and would love nothing more than to spend their money on alcohol or they are unemployed and would love nothing more than alcohol. The lines can get a little long here, but its usually not too bad. There tables in the front, booths in the back, and some drink tables in the middle. No cover. Drink prices are average.

On another note, I came here once with my good friend, the black out queen. She has somewhat recently retired that crown, but she occasionally shows glimpses of her glory days. Today was one of those days and we could not be happier. At some point during the night she decided that paying for alcohol at a bar just doesn't really make sense. So, she got herself a beer glass, reached over the bar, and poured herself a glass from the tap. We paused...looked at her...and rejoiced in sweet, sweet victory. Somehow, she skated by on that one and I've never had a more satisfying beer. And I think at this point, my black out friend believed this was how bars worked now. So, she casually went back for more and she should not have. The bartender went off on her. We stood huddled together like little school children being scolded. Our eyes scanned the floor as if we were going to find our lost dignity down there. But, we didn't get kicked out. So, another plus because of cool bartenders!

Another bar that my black out friend did not get kicked out of.
author: Arthur C.

description:
Ahh what can I say, this is my secondary local only because I don't live near by. But its my first & usually only stop when I hit Polk street.
I watch the World cup here & the atmosphere was awesome. 
Very friendly bar staff who know there stuff.
This is a true bar in all sense of the word. 
It may look & feel like an Irish bar from the outside but subtle hints let you know its more southern, with Irish flair. 
I notice the Texas longhorns are floating about the joint, but I won't hold that against them.
Go Tide!!!
author: Jennifer R.

description:
The Tender-Nob..... a neighborhood torn between classy and trashy. McTeagues comfortably borders the two neighborhoods, bringing in a crowded collection of the best of both worlds. A salon with a strong personality, stiff drinks, and sweet deals. Here you'll find a  dark, wide bar full of classic rock and colorful characters. With $2 beers and $4 well drinks - you can sip in the lively atmosphere without blowing your budget. The bar is well staffed - drink wait is short and service is attentive. Giving your more time for you to enjoy the many flat screen TVs, pool table, or jammin juke box. 

Next time your partying on Polk - make it over to McTeagues for a TenderNob treat!
author: Caroline J.

description:
So the first time I came in here, I wasn't quite sure what to make of an irish/texan bar with giant teeth hanging from the ceiling. I decided tho that for being 5 o clock on a bright sunny day, it was dark enough to feel right at home. 
There was quite an eclectic mix of people which I always see as a good sign because usually that means its a bar that makes everyone feel comfortable, which it does.
Ive been back since with friends to play pool at night and it was a consistently comfortable bar with good beers, friendly bartenders, sports and all the things required of a good local spot.
Here's where I must rave about this place. The first day I came in famished from having not eaten all day. Scribbled on a piece of paper taped to the cash register was a sign saying "$5 chicken tacos". Then I see a man in the corner with a set up that looked like he brought everything from his kitchen. (Which now I would gladly welcome any day) I wasn't too sure this was going to turn out well cause I can be a bit of a food snob. Anyway best effin tacos ever! I've dreamt about theses things several nights since! The kind gentlemen even made ours after he had already quit for the day. So if you get a chance, they're a must!
author: Vickie B.

description:
They need to fix their jukebox or something. If I hear the Ke$ha Tik-Tok song one more time, my head might explode. It played 3 times in 40 minutes on Friday night. 

It's a Texas bar, so I can't hate too much. Any bar with Shiner on tap is A-ok by me :) I usually have fun when I go here, but usually like to start the night here rather than end it.
author: Krystha B.

description:
Don't get me wrong, I like this place but it looks like someone ordered a "Pub in a Box". If they manage to stay in business for a decade or so it will eventually acquire the authentic patina of grime it deserves.

I was on my way to another bar when I walked past this place, popped my head in and asked the bartender if they allowed dogs. While the bartender was telling me that dogs are OK I noticed David Allen Coe was playing on the jukebox. SCORE!

"Hey Katie, call Gwynnie and tell her there's been a change of plans. I'll be back with Matilda."

So now I have my best girl (Katie) and my best drinking buddy (Matilda) in a bar that plays twang bangin country music and waiting for some good friends to show up. What's that, they have Shiner Bock on tap? I haven't had a Shiner in about 20 years and now that I've got that out of my system I can wait another 20. Racer 5 on tap? Oh hell yeah!

When I settled up my tab it was an embarrassingly  small amount. 
YOU HAVE NOT SEEN THE LAST OF ME!!!
author: Lance G.

description:
Let's face it, anywhere on this Polk Street strip of bars will have a somewhat marina/douchebag/fratboy contingent. However I think McTeague's is a little less so than other options! It has a lodge-sports bar like feel. On a Friday/Saturday night you will be shoulder-to-shoulder and probably won't have luck getting a table. So try their happy hour on weekdays or a Saturday afternoon. With a vast beer selection, its a great place to meet up with friends. 

If you end up on Polk Street when a bar crawl has gone terribly wrong, swing into McTeague's Saloon from some relief.
author: Halley B.

description:
This place reminds me of the Kells in Seattle and that's probably why I liked it so much. Places like this on a Saturday night...you just have to be in the mood for. Anyway, we came here for our night our in San Francisco on my bachelorette party weekend. 

We immediately scored one of the large seating areas by the front door. They had great beer on tap here and really good shots. It was also only a short cab ride from our hotel off of Market Street. I'd definitely come back here!
author: Cathy S.

description:
this place is pretty fun besides the preponderance of guys.. but then again it is SF. 

This place doesn't have cover... constantly crowded... just imagine a really really large and crowded dive bar where you have to push and pull in order to get anywhere...
Drinks are cheap and if you come with a good group you can easily have an amazing time for a fair price here.
author: James H.

description: This was my first time at McTeague's--that I can remember--and it was pretty fun. The drinks were reasonably priced and there were just your standard drinks. What pretty much makes this place is the ambiance and the people go there. It's a pretty chill environment and it easily gets packed. There wasn't anything exciting that stood out, but I definitely recommend it as a place to stop when going out or a place to include in a Friday or Saturday night bar crawl.
author: David L.

description:
So, this guy looks like every over-the-hill jock villain from every 80's movie. The lil' curly "man bang" he's using to try and cover his receding hairline is bobbing up & down as he does the robot while he's mocking my friend, and it hits me...this is a pretty shitty place to grab a drink.

I've been to this bar a few times, mostly during the last World Cup, and it was ok. I didn't think it was anything to write home about. The drinks sucked, and the beers were way too overpriced. Now, during the night time setting, just jam like God knows how many, yuppies, douches, and jobbers into that same lack-luster bar setting, and what you have is what we affectionately refer to back East as a "Hot Mess".

I don't require much from a bar. And yes, there were more than a few pretty girls there, but good luck trying to holla at them. It's was too jam-packed to even get to the bar, let alone stalk some pray. No sir, these are not the hunting grounds you're looking for. 

I don't know what my friends thought of the joint. They were three sheets to the wind, with their beer goggles strapped on tight. I'll be surprised if they remember even being there. I know that bars in SF tend to be a touch crowded and overpriced, but honestly, you can do a lot better that McTeague's. xD
author: Shirrod R.

description: Really like the bar staff at McTeague's. They're very personable and chill. The juke box was a nice touch too-they even take your pics and display them for the night.
author: Amanda V.

description:
My new favorite spot in the city. I was walking around Polk looking for a bar to kill some time before a show across the street when I spot a sign for Happy Hour that boasts $2 Lonestar beers. Cha-ching!. Love Lonestar and really miss Texas a lot so this was a win win!

Walk inside, dark enough but not dingy. Big Texas Longhorns flag on the ceiling. Paintings of Kurt Cobain and Hunter S. Thompson and Racer 5 on tap. Boondock saints and sports on the big screen tv's.

If you're a man and you're reading this and not drooling all over yourself. I'd be willing to question you're sense of manliness!
author: Tony C.

description:
Solid choice, especially if you enjoy beer.  They've got a pretty good selection of beers on tap, which during happy hours and Monday/Thursday Night Football were $3, and even when it isn't a special it is still reasonably priced.

McTeague's is a good place to go if you're with a group of friends, or if you just want to watch the game.
author: Matt N.

description: Great place and atmosphere. A little crowded on the Friday night that we went there but great place to meet people and the bartender there (the woman) was fantastic
author: Allan M.

description: Times are tough out there folks.  Especially if you've moved out here from Texas and have yet to get used to the insane prices of the Bay Area.  Luckily the owners of McTeague's has a bailout for all the beer drinkers from Texas (and anyone else who wants cheap Texan beer).  $2 bottles of Lone Star all day every day.  That's right, no matter when you walk into this place you can get a $2 beer.  Want to spend more?  They also have Shiner Bock, and Shiner 100 on tap and Shiner black in bottles for a little more.  Cold Texas beer at cheap prices in a great bar in San Francisco?  Now that's some change I can believe in.
author: Joshua W.

description:
I really was having the most excellent time here until a friend pointed out to me that out of the 14 of us in our group 5 of us, had glasses that were either cracked sideways, horizontally that is, or vertically, or had broken glass inside or outside of our drinks.  And no that is not a good thing.

So maybe McTeagues needs to invest in some need drinkwear.  Macy's is known to have great sales.  I got a whole bunch of good beer glasses on sale from my wedding!  Maybe it's time for them to stock up.  5/14 aren't good odds I would think. 

Other than that I was having a blast.
author: Denise B.

description:
Happy Hour from Noon - 7pm.  Really, do you need anything else?

Ok, here goes - McTeague's has a fantastic selection of beer that is priced at $3 a pint during happy hour or $11 for a pitcher. $11 for a pitcher of Shiner Black? Yes please!

The spacious bar also features a bunch of flat screens (they had the Champions League on Wednesday afternoon when we walked in) in addition to a pool table and a dart board in the back. This is definitely a great space to start an evening of hard drinking. 

One star off because I had to teach the bartender how to make a martini. But really, McTeague's is all about beer. Wait, is it noon yet?
author: phil h.

description: Was there for a Giants / 49ers game on 10/18 .... great atmosphere and prices for food and beer seemed reasonable .... place was hopping with both the Giants and 49ers playing. Seemed like a good spot to watch sports in the lower Polk St area.
author: F J.

description: Pimp Step Bernard is headin over 2night! Fresh butt ready to be touched by all and only males.  Look for the THOTS and pimp step will be there, butt ready.
author: Justin B.

description:
I like this place.  They have shiner bock on tap, along with about 100 other beer options.  So, this will definitely be go to beer place.  The booths are nice, especially if you just want to meet up with a few friends and catch up. 

I think this place really depends on when you go.  It gets really busy on weekends and can take forever to get a drink.  It's a little too popular with the early twenties trendy crowd slumming it on lower polk on the weekends for me.  But, early weekend nights and weeknights, it's a decent place to grab a beer.  I would even give it four stars for week day happy hours.  

But, it's definitely not the place to go to meet people.  Everyone comes in groups and hangouts with their own group.  No one really chats it up at the bar or anywhere else.  Hence, why it's a great place to catch up with friends, but not so great if you want to get out and talk to people.

Overall, this place is a solid local bar with an amazing selection of beers (on tap and not).  The bartenders are friendly, but don't except anything more than a nod when it's busy (which is fair since they are so busy).  I wouldn't order any specialty drinks here.  This is a basic pub.  You order beer or gin and tonic or vodka soda.  You don't order anything more complicated, it won't be good. I'll go back, but only on certain times and certain days when I really just want to sit and have a beer.
author: Emily G.

description:
It had booze.
It had booths.
It had an ATM.
It had a lot of dead space.
Im sorry... I cant say anything else remarkably good or bad about this place. 
Totally non descript. 
In fact this place was a bit of a drag... 

(... thats a small hint for my next review...  ;-P )

[Bar #4, 9 pints down]
author: Michael H.

description:
Great place to watch Sunday football! They have plenty of drink specials, great prices and lots of seating. There are about 6 TVs above the bar and if the game you're looking for isn't on the bartenders are really nice about switching the channel for you.

The bloody mary that I got was pretty thick and had a ton of spices in it. Not the absolute best I've ever had (a little too heavy on the spice) but certainly not the worst. I'd give it a 3.5 out of 5 stars. One thing that  I cannot stand is a watery bloody mary and you will definitely not get that here! 

I'm looking forward to coming back and trying McTeague's at night as opposed to Sunday at 10am!
author: Amanda R.

description:
Best nostalgic juke box, every song made me feel like a teenager
good beer selection, but i was doing booze, nice, stiff and cheap
and the bartender was super friendly and kept coming around, didn't once have to catch his attention, he was on it.
and then when i thought this place couldn't get any better i looked up...
author: Jacquelyne M.

description:
Pretty empty on a Saturday afternoon, even with it being the jumping off point for CrawlSF's Polk Village Bar Crawl. Unfortunately, the $20 card minimum is enough to sway an otherwise positive experience in a spacious bar with good looking guys*, tasty gin and tonics, and a big fan at the entrance that is overly conducive to drunk and windy Vogueing. 

Waitaminute - $2 shots that taste like pink grapefruit gummy candies and are called pink tacos? I've never had lesbian tendencies before, but I certainly slurped a bunch of those down. YAY PINK TACOS!

*When I say it was empty, that's because it was. Those good-looking guys came with us, 'cause that's how we roll. My group of 15 wasn't just a part of the bar crawl, we WERE the bar crawl.
author: Devon S.

description: The Marina meets the Mission - younger crowd, but cool bar!
author: Andrew B.

description: No, it's not in my neighborhood BUT, they've got anything you might possibly want to drink AND they will let you bring your food in as well as your dog.  The regulars are solid and the staff is dope.  Pool? Ball-game? Internet jukebox? Quentin Tarantino films?...They all exist here for your enjoyment.  For those trifled by the weekend madness, the weekday nights will satisfy your needs...so don't be shy.  Now, if I could just move it a little bit closer to my apartment, this place would be perfect.
author: Katrina M.

description:
I don't frequent many bars but Mcteague's may change this fact.

It's hard in a city like San Francisco who prides itself on having many fine establishments to find one bar that you want to go more than any others.

Bars are like shoes for me.  I have a lot of shoes for a guy, but I like to wear them all depending on how I feel.  Mctegaues just might be my new favorite pair of shoes.

The bar is long but wide.  It never feels too crowded but you can pack a ton of people in there. I went here twice two weekends ago, which never happens.  I had a great time both nights.  It's on Polk and Sutter so if you need a change of scene shoot over to R Bar and do some people watching.  If you feel like dancing hit up Vertigo.
author: Adam L.

description:
I must've put in $2937492374923 into the juke box and it never played my damn songs.  

I've been here twice, nothing totally stands out.  The front door guys are always super nice and friendly when checking my ID.  I don't know how much drinks are here because I've yet to pay for them on my own.  Last night (Saturday) a bunch of meat heads and douche bags were there.... but they were all generally pretty friendly.  It's a pretty decent sized space but can get super crowded (St. Patty's Day).
author: Walerz B.

description: Came here for the Lagunitas beer week event, otherwise I would have never ventured to this area of town. This place is HUGE. The bartenders were friendly but didn't seem super knowledgeable about the beer. I really enjoyed the intimate booths and live music, hell even the free bbq was nice. As a vegetarian I at least got to partake in potato salad and cole slaw, both of which helped the copious amounts of beer we had enjoyed that day. Not sure if I would return as Polk St isn't my kinda people but maybe for another beer event.
author: Cori W.

description:
McTeagues eh? 

Went there four times last week after work for a beer. They have plenty of TVs for sports, plenty of draft towers for beer, plenty of bottles on the bar to make stiff mixed drinks and a damn cool decorated interior. 

McTeagues is a very comfortable watering hole during the day. I really enjoy this place and will most definitely be going back as often as I can. 

What I didn't like was the ambient volume inside this place on a Friday night. Holy blown out ear drums, it was nuts. Maybe I'm just to old but I prefer McTeagues during the afternoon for a ball game and some beers. 

Other than that, I recommend McTeagues to anyone. 

Go Cubs!!!
author: Wayne B.

description:
Great Bar. Great Space. Tons of seating (booths, tables). Tons of standing room. TV's to watch any sports event. Lots of locals for people watching. Pool Table at the back.

Note*  Dont be fooled if I ask to get in on a game of pool...Filipinos have a natural gene to hustle in a game of billiards =)...many have be deceived.
author: Gladys D.

description:
I live in the neighborhood and enjoy stopping in during the week, or on the occasional weekend afternoon to watch baseball and eat a burger from Sliders on the corner.

The bartenders are always cool and there's enough televisions to catch any important game that might be going on.  Even had a good time gambling on the national spelling bee one evening!

Good prices on their beer during happy hour.
author: King O.

description: Came here for Halloween so can't speak to its usual action.  Spacious and didn't have funny smells, good enough for me.  It seems popular with the residents.  I only came here once when I was a resident.
author: Erika C.

description:
I love this bar.  Seriously, love at first sight, or first drink maybe.  This place is clean, there are two bathrooms for women, the juke box music is solid, AND the drinks are cheap.

I still prefer Bigfoot Bar, but I'm sure you'll see me again at McTeagues, especially because drinks are only $4 post happy hour...and I am cheap...
author: Katherine C.

description:
Nothing like some cheap busch on Polk Street!

The first few times I went here I didn't think the place was that special.  The only selling point for me were the $2 Busch cans.  The place was too crowded with balding white guys for me.

Then, reading other reviews, I found out that this place is owned by Irish-Texans.  The decor came to life for me.  I understood the randomness of the pub decor and saddles.  Also the tribute to the fallen angels of our time above the bar (R.I.P. Kurt, Hunter, Rick, Janis...) is something that no other bar has.

To seal the deal on my continued business to this establishment, I had to try the raved about happy hour.  They serve $3 pints and $11 pitchers of... not Coors... not Busch... rather Stella, Shiner Bock, Anchor Steam and everything quality you can name from noon-7pm.  And it just happened to be during the BCS National Championship where they serve FREE bbq during halftime (for all college games)!!!

If there is a must-see game on TV, I would highly recommend dropping by during happy hour and watching the game on the array of flat screens.
author: Joey S.

description: I came to watch the Woman's soccer game and it was the perfect place to do it. Not crowded at all, great crowd, and great venue. Also nice that you can bring outside food in
author: Karen T.

description:
You may be asking yourself so why oh why did they need to open up another bar on Polk Street? Well there are many reasons but I can give you 2 good ones--a) Polk has the highest concentration of bars on a city street in San Francisco and it has to maintain its title and b) as a general observation (myself living in this area on and off over the last few years) I've noticed that Polkers--regardless of age, lifestyle choices, gender, income racket, you name it--seem to take a liking both alcohol and gatherings.Over opening weekend I saw many Polk regulars from all walks of life come into get a feel of the "new family member". Judging from everyone's reactions I can assume that it will be a welcome addition to the already active nightlife. 
 
 The bar's namesake and itself is a nod to a character from Frank Norris' McTeague and to an era of San Francisco history almost forgotten (thrillist.com has more on the history of its origins both the novel and the building itself). Thoughtful decorations like the lamps, a wagon wheel on the ceiling, the high dark wood booths with thick lacquered tables and a long bar with plenty of libations quickly add to the gathering spot aura this place has already acquired. This place makes the most of its length and can definitely accommodate more than a few healthy sized clans. There is a pool table in the back (with some plush seating there as well) and apparently they plan on hosting music there at some point. For now there is a jukebox with a picture of Marilyn Monroe resting upon it. Staff members I met seemed in the custom Polk fashion of being cordial if not down right friendly.    

The selection at the bar is a healthy one. I counted at least 20+ beer taps (with minimal repeats). Popular local favorites like Anchor Steam and Prohibition Ale were amongst those present and the LARGE display of liquor set along glass shelves, against stone brick work, led me to believe that they can cover more than just the basics. Someone mentioned something about a menu but I didn't see one. Regardless of that one quibble I can say that this place has a lot to offer. Go while it still has that new bar smell to it.

2 more quick things: they open at noon (earlier than most of the bars in the immediate area) and during the week Happy Hour is from 12-7. ($3 drafts,$3 wells seems to be special). Plus Friday afternoons around 4 or 5 have an extra bonus, free food. Last week's nibbles were smoked spicy chicken drumsticks and they were as big and good as you'd expect at a friend's BBQ. Yummy!
author: Veronica G.

description:
I like me some liquor.  Maybe a little too much.  But I still like me some liquor.  Do you like you some liquor?  Here's to our no-nonsense drinking spot.

The drinks here are stiff and definitely get the job done.  All the bartenders are highly experienced (at least the ones I've met) and that means if you treat them well they'll remember and return the favor.

This is a great place to come and watch sports, kick it with friends, play pool and have yourself some drinks.  And more drinks.  And then one last one before you hit the road [but not driving of course]  Its a really big place and usually has plenty of room.  If you come on a friday or saturday night it is definitely more crowded then usual but still has ample room.
author: Justin B.

description:
I love the dark, wide space that takes me to the back of the bar without obstruction on a busy Friday night, also the booths and tables that line the wall offer plenty of seating, so the seat-vultures aren't hovering over you, waiting to swoop on your chair the second you get up. It's great!

Cool bartenders. Stiff drinks. Sweet jukebox. Great beer deals.
author: Deanna T.

description: I've been here a couple times, mostly to watch Giants and 49ers games. It's pretty chill except on weekend nights it gets pretty packed.
