There are lots of TV's, you can bring outside food in if it isn't slammed.  They have a good amount of seating. Cool place to just hang out with some friends and get a beer.  **They do have a card minimum**
author: Jen O.

description:
I happen to like McTeague's. I'm not sure how (because it isn't exactly my usual style of bar) but it turned into my go-to spot. With that said, I was surprised by how much fun I had the first time I went, and the time after that, and the time after that, etc. In fact, I continually have a good time there. It may be that I hover in the back near the pool table, and feel genuine joy when someone finally picks a good song on the juke box. Or, it may be that if you are easy to please, this is the bar for you. Lots of good beer to choose from, and even if you have to wait a second, the bartenders are normally pretty nice and make up for it.

I also like that the mix of people here is generally different, and most people are willing to get a little chatty over a game of pool. It makes it feel fun, without the awkward one-pool-table-competitiveness-vibe overwhelming everything. This bar is hard to peg...you can't really pin down the crowd with a generic catch-all, but that makes it pretty easy for you to blend in and have a good time with the people you came with.
author: Jessica B.

description:
To do it right: $17

Look! An Irish pub.
Eight dollars for one Bushmill's?!
Let's get Chinese food.

Summary: Regrettably, McTeague's is haiku-able.
author: Troy M.

description: Love this place! Tons of space, good beer, big TVs, and awesome staff. Bartenders are cool and remembered me after one extremely busy football night. Owner is great (found my money in the bathroom and gave it back to me)! Can't complain about this place.  Plus you can go anywhere on Polk to get food to go and bring in the bar.  Well not just on Polk but you get the idea.
author: Devynne H.

description:
I'd have to give this place different levels of stars for going at different times. I've been to McTeague's at night on the weekend, and I wasn't really feeling it. It was really packed, and it was hard to get a drink quickly.

However, I've been there for happy hour on Friday, which had free nachos (!) and my friend and I easily found a place to sit and relax. Then it's a really laid back bar, with a good choice of beer, and a good option for hanging out and talking with your friends, especially because they have booths. I've also been there at 8:30 on a random Monday night, and even though it was almost empty, but to me, it's more enjoyable during the off-peak hours, because you really get to enjoy the atmosphere of the bar, and see then I start to understand why it's called McTeague (after the book) because of the nice wood decor and saloon vibe. 

Overall, I'll go back, but mostly because I live right nearby, and not on a Saturday night -- then maybe I'll head down the block to one of the other hundreds of bars nearby.
author: Ashley H.

description: McTeague's is always a sure bet when just wanting to meet up with friends and have a good time. Can't go wrong.
author: Bridget B.

description:
A great new bar to open on Polk street.  Came in here after a happy hour at R Bar and was quite pleased with the joint.  It has a midwest feel to it...bigger than your average SF bar.  There is also a renaissance feel to the decor.  Drinks seemed pretty reasonable.  The crowd seemed like potential for being a good crowd.  

I'll be back I'm sure.
author: Beth R.

description: I liked McTeague's, it reminds me of Bacchus Kirk but lighter.  I recently went to watch some basketball and it wasn't a bad spot.  We left Ace's because Badger fans took over the joint and well red doesn't look good on me.  McTeague's wasn't too crowded, had a bunch of TV's and the booths are nice and intimate.  I was a bit confused about the roped off area in the back that said, "Private Party" yet there were only two people back there on the pool table.  Maybe everyone else hadn't shown up at that point.   I guess in theory it would be fun to have the pool table to yourselves but I also feel like it is 100% selfish.  I mean, this is a bar, how can you bogart the table like that.    Either way, for the area, I liked it.   I would probably go back.  It was clean, the decor was fun and the crowd was less D-Bag than some of the other venue's Friday night clientele.
author: Kristin Marie S.

description:
Have you ever wanted to listen to country music while sitting in an Irish pub?  I didn't know that I wanted to either, but it turns out that it was just what the doctor ordered! 

In my neverending quest to find the interwebs in places that I can sit in without having a major freakout, I came across McTeague's.  That's right, a bar with interwebs!  Joy.  Plus, the owner (I think) even made sure I sat somewhere where I could keep my computer plugged in.  Shcore.

And the Irish/Texan mishmash is almost just right.  I personally have ZERO problem hearing some Morrissey right after Johnny Cash.  It's the kind of warm misery that works perfectly for a rainy afternoon when you're contemplating the future and could probably use a good cry.

Oh, and it looks like they have fun televised game days where you can revel with others who like the watch the ball go far!  And eat free food, of course.
author: Coco D.

description:
I guess I finally crawled out from under my rock 'cause I made it over to this place and was shocked to find out it's been open for two months. So far, it meets all my criteria for  a bar.For a SF bar, it definitely surpasses them.

Friendly bartender- check
Room to breathe- check 
pool table, darts AND seating- check
Beer Selection-  SO satisfying
One inch puddle or less in the bathroom and no smell stronger than those encountered in my days as a public school janitor- CHECK 
People watching- not as many freaks and geeks as I'd like but still enough to keep me somewhat entertained
Hot men- oh yeah, we're still in SF. Forget this category.

Overall- stay away from Polk Street!, It sucks and you're way better off going to North Beach.

P.S. Probably should update this after a weekend visit. We'll call it test-retest validity. Research people!
author: deb C.

description:
I'm still trying to figure out if this place is for real.  Country bar?  PWT bar?  Rock bar?  Saloon?  What's going on?  Hmmm.  It was dead on a Sunday night and I was very confused as to why there was someone checking ID's at the front door when NO ONE was there.  

But the Bartender did make me a delicious filthy martini and give me as many olives as I wanted.  Also he hooked me and my friend up.  Two cocktails and the beer and shot special for $10.  He rocked!

I'm sure this place is more fun when people are actually there.
author: Justine D.

description:
Came in hoping that they would have some nice memoribilia relating to Frank Norris, who was the author of the great American novel about the dentist who lived on Polk St.  that gave this bar it's name  -- and who is immortalized down the street by Frank Norris alley...)   This book was also the basis for Eric von Stroheim's magnum opus, the silent film GREED which was originally more than 10 hours long (a really great film, starring Zasu Pitts...)

Unless they've added some -- no memorabilia.  I was sorely disappointed, and went to the bar to order a drink (it was quiet) and asked the AfricanAmerican bartender if there was any memorabilia?  He said no -- and I said that was a shame, as Frank Norris was my great-uncle.  He peered at me and repeated what I said...and then we had the most wonderful conversation!  He knew a GREAT deal about Norris and McTeague.  

Wow!  that was unexpectedly nice.  I've started to go in a couple of times, but the loud, drunken crowd looked rabid and I'm not sure my shots are current...
author: L M.

description:
It has been a really long time since I walked into a bar and totally didn't feel like the odd mexican out, It's mainly my fault, I am highly sensitive and overly self conscious, but for what ever reason, McTeague's left me feeling happy, confident and ready to take on Godzilla in a no holds bar, last one standing, cage match. 

The ladies there last night was very attractive, even the not so attractive ladies has personality for days, so in turn, made them attractive (did I cover my ass on that one?) Everyone there was handsome. I didn't have to get shit faced to enjoy myself. AND! A McCallan 12yr whiskey was $8.00! I think this has been the cheapest place I have had this... I spent $21.00 or so somewhere in the city for the same drink. I took 1 star away because the last whiskey i ordered wasn't whiskey at all, but vodka... but I guess it was ok since i was driving anyways. I Really enjoyed this place, and the company I was with.
author: danny e.

description:
This place is great!  I don't know how I always end up here every time I am on Polk, but there you go.

1) Drunken stupor.  We grabbed chairs around a barrel and ordered away.
2) Not-so-drunken stupor.  Had a drink and went on our merry way.
3) College football night.  It was surprisingly empty in there, so empty that I got a table.  Drinks were cheap, and the entertainment was fantastic!
author: Jenny L.

description:
My enjoyment of the bar scene has greatly diminished in the past year, either a sign of getting old, or that I'm usually just bored out of my mind. I'm done shouting above bad music and dealing with obnoxious drunks, and I'm not spending a lot of money on booze when I'm not big drinker. I fully admit a club is not much different, but at least I can dance.

So McTeague's was a nice find, as beers are cheap ($3 for a Miller Lite doesn't feel like a waste of money) and there is a massive jug of water available for patrons. No waiting for a bartender to get you a glass.

Music was still bad, but that's just my little world I live in.

Were I headed out for drinks in Nob Hill and had to recommend a place, this spot would be near the top of the list.
author: Jason B.

description:
I think this place looks like a nice place to hang out. Was over here on Saturday night and it was pretty crowded. So this spot seems to on it.  The only thing I wish it had was some good music, I didnt really notice any songs in the background since it was so crowded.  Its like Elbo Room crowded and its a bigger bar.

The drinks flow well here and get to you pretty fast, which definitely is a plus since this place is pretty crowded.

Good crowd of folks. Good place to start the night and then roll over Vertigo to get your groove on if thats on your list of To-Do's for the evening.

One thing I just learned is their Happy Hour's are super long and have pretty good prices.
author: Mark L.

description:
What?!  A new place in Polk Gulch!  This place is a step up from the other standbys in the neighborhood.  It's nice to step into a new/clean establishment on this part of Polk.

What's good - for starters a full bar with over 10 quality beers on tap. I'm not a huge whiskey or bourbon fan but these guys have a lot to choose from.  Go for the house Pale Ale.   

There is also a decent selection of  food (small plates) on the menu. Also the booths are nice as is the pool in the back.

The interior is a bit kitsch but then again so are a lot of the other places on Polk.
author: Doug C.

description: This is a great bar with great people working there. I walked in with my buddy having just been on the road for 5 hours, and got a great reception. The bartenders drank along side us, and really helped the mood out a lot.
author: Jeffrey L.

description:
In spite of it's Irish name, this place really has nothing to do with an Irish bar. Other than the fact that people go here and get drunk. 

The few times I've been in McTeague's I've had a great time. It's a pretty large space inside. Pool table provided in the rear. The first time I ever went here was actually part of a birthday pub crawl and the place held all 20 or whatever of us fine, we took over an area in the back, I had too many shots of fernet, it was great! 

Really friendly bartenders, lots of folks that know each other around there. I'd comment on the drink prices but now that I think of it I've never paid for a drink in this place, I somehow always get someone to buy 'em for me here... Guess I should go more often!
author: Andy A.

description:
Lots of white caps and blond hair, screaming Journey and Mellencamp songs while pointing at the ceiling and each other. It's not a bad thing, it's just not my thing. 

In a way it's nice to have this to counterbalance the hipsters taking over the TL.
author: Edward P.

description: On what was supposed to be a chill Thursday evening, McTeagues became one of my many stops along Polk street where I proceeded to take back shots and drink a few vodka gimlets. Definitely not a super hip bar, but one where you grab drinks with friends and chat it up. Bartenders were attentive, drinks not too pricey.
author: Jackie M.

description: Nice atmosphere and friendly staff make mcteague's an all around good neighborhood bar. This is my bar of choice for sporting event viewings within the polk-post area.
author: Maggie V.

description: Looks really cool.  Opens tonight.  I May go tonight... if I do, there will be a real review here soon.
author: Joshua E.

description:
Great place! I loved the friendly service, quality mixed drinks, and rock bottom happy hour prices. The "happy hour" is a bit of a misnomer, at McTeague's it's actually a happy 7 hours (12-7 i think), but who am I to complain?

Really cool bartenders and great Irish Car Bombs - how can you go wrong?
author: Jay S.

description: Came here after a work event with a friend and must admit the service sucked.  One of the waitresses was taking shots with customers a table over from me, while our actual waitress was nowhere to be seen.  After fifteen minutes of waiting I decided to order drinks from the bar.  Let's not forget the fact that it wasn't busy!...the cool waitress who rips shots with customers didn't even ask if we were being waited on. When I asked the bartender if it's normal that the staff drinks on the job he responded "yes'.  That's good to know?  I wonder if the cooks are doing the same thing.  The atmosphere wasn't bad though, but to consider this place an Irish pubs is an insult to true Irish pubs.
author: John L.

description: Give me free things and I'm a fan. They had a free buffet! Also, Coors Light was only $2. The main reason I'm a fan, however, is that when a drunk dude got up to some douchebaggery, one of the employees approached him and told him to knock it off because he was bugging people. I can't think of a better place to watch the Superbowl.
author: Merrilee T.

description:
Killed time here for about 3 hours.

A bit on the expensive side and they don't serve food (BOO!).

Staff was friendly and the beer was cold but it was pretty hot inside that joint. 

A lot of seating with a middle aged mixed crowd. 

Didn't really have much to complain about and I really liked how dark it was in the booths here. 

Pool table and darts to boot. 

Perfectly OK spot to kill some time.
author: John Z.

description: Got a beer here (before Iron Cupcake), they had a good selection. I liked the ambiance, very pub-ish and relaxed. There's a lot of premier-league flags up and the bartender was really attentive.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Now one of my favorite hangouts on Polk south of California. Great selection of whiskies and bourbons. Get the Bulleit Bourbon!  

Came here before a concert at the Regency (which sucks as a venue by the way). Looking forward to returning for happy hour!
author: Joel L.

description:
McTeagues, my long lost friend I've been looking for and now always around. You appear with open arms and "nothing to hide, believing what I say". 

A place that can not only quench my thirst, but could have saved Mac himself in Death Valley. Great space with plenty of room and a few nooks, not some hole where you are continuously bumping into everyone. I dig the style here and appreciate the change from norm - $2 Busch and not the same'ol cheap beer option in Pabst. Solid location with places all around to get some grub at half time - yes, they have the NFL ticket not just broadcast! And everyone I've met that works there has been pretty cool, so I'll keep coming back for sure.
author: Mike C.

description: Solid 4 stars for McTeagues. The bartenders are always super quick to take drink orders, the bouncers aren't jerks, and the actual bar space is bigger than most of the Polk St bars. For these reasons McTeagues is definitely good enough to make it one of my go to bars!
author: Kelly N.

description: Always packed full of loud & obnoxious bros.  Stupid crowds. $10 Irish car bombs.
author: Scott G.

description:
i was surprised at the size of mcteague's saloon.

in the back was a room with ample standing/walking space. tables were rather abundant on this friday eve and the drinks were moderately priced.

in all, a stable bar on the polk walk.
author: Ameer N.

description: This is my favorite bar in the Polk/Bush area.  The new booths in the back are awesome and there is always a good crowd.  Get there early or you'll be waiting in a long line.
author: Jason D.

description: Two dollar Shiner Black + complimentary nacho bar + dog friendly = GOOD TIMES!  This place rules!
author: Dana D.

description: I'm not a big bar person anymore (yeah I'm getting old) but after hearing about McTeague's Saloon I was very curious to check it out.  I met with an old co-worker here last week and I really liked the place.  It was a much larger bar then I thought with a full bar, seating across from the bar at stand up tables and booths and a pool table in the back.  A good size crowd was out too.  Since McTeague's is close to my place and a very cool bar I will come back.
author: Blake B.

description:
I went here one Friday night to meet up with two 'friends of a friend', and was ditched.  I wasn't devastated, because it was a pretty decent place.  They played Tom Petty on the Juke at one point.

This is still my first month in the City, and I don't have any real friends-- so going to a bar like this one solo is a little bit overwhelming.

In conclusion, I'll go back during a happy hour or on a Saturday morning...
author: L J.

description: Laid back and divey. Things that make me feel comfortable at a bar . Much rather go here than the Hemlock
author: Lauren V.

description: Too expensive to be a dive bar, but not too pricey, with a dark lighting feel.  Plenty of specialty drinks.  I will definitely come back here.
author: Joel M.

description:
Had a great night here. the bartender, brigid, was a delight. the drinks are well priced & wonderfully served. i came here solo & left feeling like i had met my friends there. 
Great staff, friendly saloon...
author: Amanda P.

description: I'm a pretty big fan of this bar, there's plenty of seating/standing space, a good sized bar counter space to order drinks, a lively crowd on Friday and Saturday, good happy hour prices during the week, and great service from the bartenders. There's a pool table in the way back, but it's pretty much always in use so be prepared to beat someone first before you can play for friends. The crowd is young, in their 20s, and I've met someone from abroad every night I've gone, so it's pretty well cultured.
author: Anthony C.

description: This place was great.  Was in San Fran and needed a place to watch the Longhorn football game.  They were friendly and had Shiner on draft.  Fun atmosphere during the football game and good beer.  What else do you need.
author: Allen P.

description: Despite the fact that McTeague's has a bunch of nice flat screens, booths to chill in, and pretty cool bartenders, I still couldn't really get into it. Mainly because of the crowd. I partially think it was because I was in a shitty mood and came here after a long weekend, but then the other part of me thinks it's because I'm just reaching a point where I've been to a shit ton of bars like this and they're fast losing their cool factor to me. Either way I plan on going back and giving McTeague's a chance when I'm in a little bit better of a mood. For now though, three stars it is.
author: Tommy P.

description: I gave McTeague's a 3 but it could be better next time because I liked the place. The problem I had was the music was inaudible, mainly a thumping base and the bartender seemed new (slow and not talkative). There were lots of people which is always nice and lively and since the place was large and it was still pretty early it wasn't totally packed (which I liked). We tried the Nachos but I wouldn't do it again unless I was really hungry. I'm not a fan of the canned cheese sauce, the guacamole wasn't good but we did finish the plate so it wasn't all bad but we were very hungry.
author: Dianne M.

description:
The Blonde Woman Bartender rocks, I ordered close to 10 different drinks for my group and she got them all right. 

While I will return to this bar, there are a few qualifiers...mainly that I won't go back on a holiday/mass drinking day for the public. Some of our drinks got spilled by an employee who didn't appologise or assist in cleaning.  

When I called to complain the next day I spoke with Chris, he was very kind, appologetic and offered to refund my money...I don't need my money refunded, just an appology.
author: Amanda R.

description: This place a great spot to drink watch sports and waste an entire day. The bartenders are great and do an awesome job of remembering every stupid thing or person you have done. Its like cheers but the staff wont take any crap from you. The guests are all types. Preppy d-bags to the old local drunks. Everynight is different. You can count on one thing every time. Good Drinks, Good Conversations, And a story you will have to tell to your friends that usually starts with "Dude 5 mins after you left...."
author: Michael T.

description: I went to college in Austin, TX.  How thrilled am I to walk into a bar that has $2 Lone Stars (during happy hour), and Tito's Vodka!!!!  WooHoo!  I had a great time on a lazy Monday afternoon, watching various games on the TV's and chatting with my friend.  Not sure if it becomes the kind of frat house bar that I stayed away from on 6th St. in Austin on a Sat night... but I am willing to give it a try.  The place was clean and staff was friendly. No complaints really.  Thanks UT Alumni!
author: Kimmy C.

description: This place is great, I can't believe I have been to all the douchiest places on Polk yet never been to McTeague's before the last few months. The bartenders here are funny . . can't quite figure out how to describe them but I love them!  They're laid back and just. .I don't know, cool.  The 2 times I have been here I have left very drunk, and now I am sitting here hoping I left a tip, a good tip. . when I left last night.  Usually I leave too much cash when I'm drunk but the problem is I had no cash yesterday and I can't fathom that I was doing math very well adding up tips at 2am drunk ..  so . .shit!  Guess i have to go back there  .. just to make sure I tipped. ..maybe I should pre-tip in case I get all drunk there again.
author: Muriel D.

description: Simply A-OK, I mean what is there really to say? It's a bar. A place to stand around, drink beer, play some pool, and talk to your friends. I would probably go back just because it seemed to have a nice laid back crowd for a Saturday night.
author: Sonya D.

description: Stella, Sierra on tap. Cheap ass 2 dollar bottles of Lone Star and a cool cat, jive talkin bartender named Curtis is what makes this bar a favorite for me and my drinking buddy.
author: Andrew Z.

description: This is one of my go-to local bars.  It's roomy enough so that I don't ever feel like I'm trapped in a long hallway packed full of strangers.  Otherwise- its a bar.  Dark wood, plenty of beer.  No PBR, which I find a little strange, but I guess maybe at age 30 I should try to class it up a bit anyway.   The crowd is mostly locals (except for Irish holidays).
author: Amanda B.

description: $2 Shiner Blacks all day every day, or Chimay if I'm living life that day - yay!!!  And you just may get some free chili out front, or a chili buffet inside...you just never know...love the staff and the regulars at this place...
author: Brooke C.

description: Any bar with a picture of Shane MacGowan on the ceiling is A-OK with me. Bartender and clientele were super friendly. Meant to stay for one drink but ended up staying for hours. Being from out of town, I though SF would be full of aging hippie douche-bags, but places like this helped correct my bias.
author: Sean W.

description:
Im rarely in the city but found myself there two nights ago. Had gone to some crappy bar that I felt horribly out of place, walked down the street to this lovely gem just to fit right in. Welcomed by the Johnny Cash music and a handlebar mustached bartender who makes me feel at home, I walked up to order a PBR. "Nope, PBR's too classy.. We do have LoneStar though." This is one of the reasons for my 5star rating. I visit Texas a few times a year, and have been looking for my beloved Lonestar since returning from my last visit. 
All in all this place made me very happy, let me slip out of the city atmosphere, into an awesome saloon that I'll be returning to again. On top of Lonestar they have ShinerBock on tap served in rad mason jars. I also liked the paintings depicting legends who've passed (Janis Joplin, Cobain, Rick James!) as angels, and the big Texas Longhorns flag. I guess I could keep writing about everything I like.. because thats just it..I loved everything. Oh! And they have pool too.
I know that I'll be coming here every time I find myself in San Fran.
author: Lucia P.

description: Many years ago, I fished a tattered paperback copy of Frank Norris' "McTeague" from a filthy bin at a used book store and couldn't put it down. It's a 19th century novel about the complacent misery of a Polk Street area dentist who hates his wife and loves his beer. Regardless of the literary tribute, I adore this pub for its mixed crowd and enveloping warmth, despite being such a cavernous space. Yes, I think Dr. McTeague himself would be happy to belly up to its beautiful bar for numerous pints to try and forget his troubles. And I'd definitely buy the first round.
author: Gregor G.

description: Not bad. Never really feel welcome in this bar. Maybe it's just me, but I don't know. Drinks aren't bad. I guess it's not my scene.
author: Stafford J.

description: This is a great bar.  Super spacious and prices are normal.  Went there on a Thursday night and it was happening.  Since it so large, it does not get too crowded.  Gonna try to catch a game here as well since many TV screens.
author: Chuck Q.

description:
McTeagues lies directly in the path of least resistance from the bus stop to my doorstep which makes this is a very dangerous situation.  It's a great place to stop and have a couple (half-dozen) Anchor's to fortify my body for the long (3 block), cold, walk home.  The bartenders are friendly (Amber is great), the beer is always cold and cheap, and the games are always playing.  Good group of regulars and welcoming to anyone that walks in.

If you are down on Polk Street, stop in and say hello.
author: Matt A.

description: A staple to the Polk St bars, McT is just a downright old school place to grab cheap drinks and hang. they got a long bar that runs all the way down the place and booths where you can chill and talk. This place is like the neighborhood bar around the corner where everybody knows your name not named "Cheers".
author: Ed L.

description: I always go to this place and I've never EVER had an issue to where I thought, "maybe I shouldn't come here anymore."  The folks who frequent it are nice and seem no-nonsense since my favorite bartender Amber kicked out one very drunk and rude doucher who flipped me off (granted I was giving him the dirty eye because I had encountered him earlier in the evening and watched him run out on his tab).  Their happy hour is fantastic...so good and I love the saloon feel.  Go here if you want to chill and have a drink that's not going to cost you an hour's pay, but don't go here and be a douche because no one in the joint's going to tolerate that.
author: Veronica S.

description: Great place. Crowded and hard to get a beer at the bar. Drafts beers fo 4.50. Did I say hard to get a beer, how about damn near impossible to get a beer at the bar that is 4 deep. Order two when you go up, that will help your situation. As I'm standing at the bar, I heard one guy say to his friend there's a lot of meat heads in here. As I looked around he was right. I also noticed that the people here get pretty wasted compared to some of the other bars around town. I was surprised there were no fights outside at closing time, but I did see people not able to walk straight. Very hard to move around inside as it is very over crowded. Everyone seemed to be in good spirits and looked like they all knew each other. All in all, I had good time. Forgot to mention. Good 80's music was playing. That was a plus watching the drunks dancing. lol.
author: Joe A.

description: Polk street bars rock, and I totally love McTeague's! Never have a bad time here! Friendly and fun atmosphere. Lot's of places to sit if you catch a table. Friendly bartenders. Great place to chill, drink, party, good crowd!
author: Chrissy A.

description: This is the space next to O Reilly's Holy Grail which has been empty forevers. It is now a spacious saloon with Shiner bock and good selection of whisky.  Woo!
author: Wakako U.

description: This is a pretty good place to come for some low priced brew or well drinks. Definitely a place to start off the night since it is low priced. The crowd there is mixed and can sometimes be too loud to talk in. I dont go to concerts to yell, so I dont dig bars where I have to do the same thing...start the night a little early, get your drinking done here!
author: Shaye S.

description: Spent last evening there, and  McTeagues was a great time. Rolled in at 10, played pool the whole nite, and left happy at 1:30. The drinks are reasonably priced, and they have good amount of bartenders working. Great mix of people in there every time I go. Good location that is convenient for people coming from other parts. Great neighborhood bar that does not feel too divey. Shot 'n' a beer!
author: John F.

description: Neat little Irish bar. I don't really know what it is about McTeague's, but I ALWAYS have a great time there. Been there for happy hours during the week, and it is not nearly as crowded as it is on the weekends but still have a fun vibe to it. It gets pretty packed on the weekends and turns into any other Polk street bar. Unless you find a table or a corner, you may find yourself being pushed around a bit on the weekends but hey - it's just like any other Polk street bar.
author: Janie Y.

description: The perfect place to sit with friends in dark booths and sip english-style warm beer.
author: Mason G.

description: Dark, spacious, Irish, Texan, beer, pool, booths, fun.
author: L C.

description: Went here once with a larger group and we managed to get a table near the front. Place was absolutely jammed, but we still had a good time. Chill staff across the board. Really don't know anything about it other than someone involved (assuming the owner) seems to love Texas and they serve cold beeahs. Check.
author: D S.

description: Great place to hang out.  McTeague's is a very spacious and open bar with a great pool table in the back.  The seating is always open at the bar or at the booths.  I live in North Beach and have gone to many a seedy bars just to try to play pool but I would definitely make my way to McTeague's instead.
author: Tira F.

description: Probably my most recent favorite bar to go to on Polk street, let alone all of SF.  Just a great long bar, with great drink specials and lots of different areas of seating, whether it be booths, bars, or tables.  Pool table in the back.  This place is awesome.
author: Charles C.

description: Great spot. Lots of ice cold drafts, great church pews and solid barstaff. They always take care of you. Extra points for jukebox and $2 beer options.
author: Patrick O.

description: I love to check out a new bar in my favorite neighborhood.  I went on a Monday night so the place was pretty empty (just how I like it).  Great decor, plenty of room and a great atmosphere.  My roommate tells me a pint of Stella was $4 so that's about right for the area.  It's nice to have a new place to swing by when on Polk.
author: Corey V.

description: One word to describe McTeague's - WIDE. I know that is a really weird reason to like a bar, but it's just perfectly spacious without feeling "big." I never realized how narrow most bars in SF are until I came here. It's one of my favorite bars in the city. I just feel happy when I'm here and I like the gold molars on the ceiling.
author: Rose K.

description: Good place to get rowdy with some seemingly authentic Irish folks.  Loud music and beer stained floors.  Not too many douches venture into this place so it makes for good group gatherings.  Quick bar service and friendly as well.  Good times always to be had here.
author: Sean M.

description:
good: parking and lots of people on a friday night
bad: my drink wasn't strong enough and the crowd didn't seem all that sociable
overall, i would go again but make sure to ask them to make my drink STRONG. my long island tasted GOOD. it isn't supposed to taste good. it is supposed to taste strong and eff you up. i did not get effed up.
author: sigourney w.

description: This is a solid option on Polk street to get a drink with friends!  I happened to wander into this place with a friend recently, and decided to check it out.  It was fairly new, with nice tables, spacious floor, and good decor of inviting wood and wall hangings.  The most important part to me was the bartenders were friendly, the drinks fairly inexpensive (similar to most places on Polk, so not necessarily that special on that dimension), and the service was prompt.  It definitely seems like a good place to start off the night for a couple hours, although maybe not spend an entire night there.
author: Lemar H.

description:
McTeague's would normally only get 3 stars out of me, but I do like what they've done with the space, which was empty for years before they moved in.

Right next door to the now-defunct Mayes/Midpoint bar debacle, I was skeptical of this place at first.  Because it opened up right after Mayes closed down, it appeared to be a feeble effort by the previous owners of Mayes to recoup the tons of $$ they had plowed into the failed venture.

But thankfully, it appears that McTeague's is here to stay.  It occupies a very welcome place in a string of bars on that stretch of Polk.

What McTeague's does right: it's nice and dark and inviting.   It doesn't try to be a typical Irish sports bar.  It's not too fancy, not too divey, the drink prices are not excessive.  It's fairly inviting inside, with a long bar on one side.  Bartenders have always been efficient and pleasant.

It could use more personality, but hopefully that will come in time.  Also, it would be nice if they were to start serving bar food, as well as think about hosting select local live music on certain nights.  Then I'd bump this place up a star.
author: Dave N.

description: Nice place to get your pint on.  Guiness was going for $4 on my visit.  The place is huge by SF standards, which gets McTeague's the fourth star.  The stools at our table were a bit unsteady, which made me wonder if they'd witnessed their share of rows.  You know how we 1/4-Irish like to duke it out.
author: Daryl E.

description: After having a couple glasses of wine at S.N.O.B. we went a few doors down to McTeague's Saloon which was pretty much empty. It was a Sunday night, so it was expected. We went straight to the bar ordered a beer and then back to the pool table and played a couple rounds with our roommates (quarters needed) . If it's possible to take over the back little section with a group of your friends I would say, that is the best way to get the full advantage of the bar. We will have to venture back on another night when I'm sure it will have a bunch more people. http://www.sanfrancisconoobs.com/07-13-2009/s-n-o-b-wine-bar-and-mcteague%e2%80%99s-saloon-in-nob-hill/
author: Casi C.

description: I don't like being deceived.  The website states that happy hour drink prices are $3 for well and draft drinks.  I went there for happy hour last night and ordered a vodka and 7up and it was 4 bucks.  Popov and that bar do not deserve my four bucks.  Oh, and the atmosphere is shitty with blaring tvs and horrible lighting, even though the tables are nice and woody.  Lamelamelamelameliarslamelamelame.
author: Liza W.

description: The most comfortable spot on Polk to just pop in, relax, and feel welcome.
author: Chris V.

description: Great new place. Lots of good tap beer, nice to see shiner bock on the bill. Nice whiskey choices. Beer was 4$ a pint sunday night, lets see if the price goes up. Pool table for 1$ juke box. I liked the decor old red wood ,lots of room, big wood booths for social gatherings. Friendly bartender. One guy at the bar even bought a round for everyone . Very cool! Also named after one of my favorite books of fiction called "Mcteague" by Frank Norris a must read if you live or hang in the hood.
author: Don j. c.

description: The location is hard to beat: nice bar in the middle of Polk St. My Margaritas were generous pours and even nicer at only $5. I was there to watch the Giants...and well, apparently every game my friends have watched at McTeauge's has ended in lots of tears. They were convinced the Giants were gonna lose...which they did. But I think the dignity was lost long ago: my friend fell off a bar stool. In any case, good service for being super-packed, pleasant bartenders despite the loud patrons, and good drinks for cheap. Liked it and will be back.
author: Sarah H.

description:
rad neighborhood bar [on a weeknight]. this is the kind of place i want to bring a few homies [on a weeknight] and kick it in an atmosphere thats wide open, not too loud, plays the right music [our choice on a jukebox weeknights], has a pool table, serves a decent selection of good beers [in pitchers], and has a great special [$2 lonestar pints...all the time].

too bad i dont live nearby, or else id be a regular.
author: Jon W.

description: I really like this bar. Its got a great vibe, good jukebox, pool table and its nice and roomy. Probably one of my favorite bars in the city as of right now!
author: R T.

description:
Guinness: $5

Walking into your friend's conversation about sandwich vaginas: priceless.
author: Shannon M.

description: I love the bar. The story behind the name is what gives this pub originality. Mcteague is a book written about A man on Polk street in the 1890s. Its a fun different kind of place.
author: Jeffrey A.

description: Forgot to Yelp this spot. Went here the other night and just really didn't get what the hype is about. Maybe it was an off night...The scene was very odd. The drinks weren't great. Don't see going back anytime soon!
author: Sarah R.

description:
Happy Hour from noon  to 7...check
Booths that make you feel classy and at the same time give you an opportunity to not have to hang out at the bar...check
Pool table...check
Classic country blaring on the jukebox...check
Did I mention the happy hour from noon to 7? Because that's pretty awesome.
author: Masha B.

description:
Went here for a friend's birthday in January only to return in March for my own. 

I called on Wednesday to reserve two booths for the upcoming Saturday night and the woman on the phone said she'd get the info to the boss but doesn't see it as a problem. Said she'd get him to call and verify with me. Thursday rolled around and I didn't get a call and totally forgot. Friday morning I called back to make sure I'll have the booths - I was expecting about 12 people and figured most would like somewhere to sit. Same woman on the phone, remembered me, said the boss "hasn't come back yet" but still didn't think it'd be a problem. Ok fine, no biggie. 

Saturday night! Dinner at 21st Amendment then on to McTeague's. It's my birthday, I'm ready for some birthday drinkie and good times with friends. Part of my group and I walk in around 9p (the time we reserved the booths for) and I notice every booth have people sitting in 'em. Two booths were reserved for someone else. Well this sucks. I let a bartender know whats up and he gets the boss-man. Boss comes up to me and is totally nice and understanding, I let him know of my phone calls.. etc. He gets us temporary seats and lets us know people he knows are in some of the booths and we'll get the booths when they leave ("they were planning to leave soon" he says) and then gets my friends and I a free round of drinks. He was very nice about it all and I have no qualms about it. By the time the rest of my group showed up we had at least one booth and tall table and a short time after that the second booth opened up.

Overall the experience was great. My friends who haven't been here before all enjoyed it and thought it was a pretty chill place. Will keep this place on my "the list" and return again!
author: Jennifer B.

description:
fun on football sundays.
lame on weekend nights.
i thought i walked into the rockit room or some shit. 
take your sports hats and square toed leather shoes elsewhere.
or wait. i just wont come back, save you the trouble.
author: Tim B.

description: Based on the location I was not sure what to expect but I love the interior.  It was pretty quite when we were there but it is a nice place to watch sports. The jukebox was playing Johnny Cash and they have a lot of great beers on tap including Shiner Bok (which is hard to get outside of Texas). The  taps seemed to have an issue as some of the beers tasted funky (plasticy) but the bartender replaced them without question which was good service.
author: Courtney R.

description: Dudes.$12 for a red breast and s small pour at that! Live in the area....lots of bars....I'm just sayin'
author: Roger A.

description:
The last time I was here I swore never to come in again- me & a friend stood right in front of two bartenders for over five minutes & were completely ignored while they chatted away- not helping customers, just chatting & ignoring us (maybe we didn't have the right vibe)

This time we went in & the Amazing Liz was behind the bar- she completely changed my opinion on McTeagues. Great service, she remembered my groups order through numerous re-orders, and I never saw her without a smile. If she's working, a definite 4-5 stars. Without Liz.... well, lets say that I only hope the other bartenders step up to the plate & become as good as her.
author: Eric S.

description:
Great bar.  The only issue I had was with a bouncer, but the owner himself took care of the situation in a way that not only made me feel good about coming back, but seemed to make the bouncer less antagonistic towards me.  I really appreciated that.  I know it can be tough being a bouncer, but I also know that a patron should be treated with respect.  The owner took both into account and I will definitely spend more time and money there in the future.

Bartenders are cool too.
author: a e.

description:
okay i am not gonna lie. the first few times i came here i walked away a little confused. for example they have my favorite vodka (jean marc xo) but would always charge me a different price for it (ranging from 5-12 bucks). and no. i always order it the same way. rocks lemon twist. so its not like they charge more for rocks vs mixed drinks or whatever you were thinking.  however, being a main stay for a lot of my friends (the bar that is) i have had to venture to this establishment quite often. it has grown on me (see the four star rating). lots of space, not crazily loud, usually some rather fine ladies (and dudes, e.g., myself and my friends).  i have grown to like mcteagues. you should check it out. 
oh yea. they finally started being consistent with their jean marc xo prices: $8.
author: Jason B.

description: used to go to molly mcgees and now i got to mcteagues. kinda of a fan of irish pubs. its a pretty big area and lots of tvs. great for watching hte giants limited to seating but oh well. i wish when the playoffs are on they would play the giants on more tvs...who really cares about other teams when the home town heros are kicking ass and taking names.
author: Ashley H.

description: Awesome place, its a lot of fun with a great crowd.
author: luis a.

description: The bar itself is really nice and chill. It's a great place for Happy Hour and a great place to watch games. I also think their drink prices are reasonable when compared to other bars. The only problem I had with the bar is the music. They played some of the worst music I ever heard at a bar. Maybe I picked a wrong night but for me to change my mind on the ratings, the music needs to start getting a little better.
author: Nir B.

description: A cute, cozy local (for me) pub that you can casually walk into and expect to find a seat or table for yourself. The bartender is very generous. She was very generous with my scotch.
author: Kelly G.

description: I'm a big fan of this bar.  You can get a beer for 2$.  And it's a great place to watch NFL games on Sundays; nowhere near as crowded as all those bars up near Broadway.  Cool portraits on the ceilings too.
author: John C.

description:
McTeagues is my new favorite bar in SF...great crowd, good beer selection, bartenders are very friendly...and it's an awesome space. Pretty much your ideal neighborhood bar!

There will be a great event December 11th...COME CHECK IT OUT!

Facebook Event: http://www.facebook.com/home.php?ref=home#/event.php?eid=63535080800&ref=mf

Evite: http://www.evite.com/pages/invite/viewInvite.jsp?inviteId=GJMREJVIWUGHMOZSPKQG
author: Rebecca C.

description: Great place with a pool, lots of seats, cheap beer and a friendly atmosphere
author: laurent c.

description: Great bar for watching soccer (football) opens at 6am for EPL games and can't wait for the world cup next year. Michael is a great bar tender who makes awesome bloody marys and he's a nice bloke for a Chelsea fan.
author: Noel W.

description: Good tap selection, friendly bartender. Can't complain. They have a pool table, along with a ton of cues, in the back if you're feeling up for a social game. The crowd here was pretty friendly, although it wasn't very full on a Sunday night.
author: David W.

description: This bar is so gay that even Boy George would take the time to roll down the window in a passing car and yell Fag.  Seriously though, there are a lot of fun bars on Polk.  Walk past this one.
author: Ross F.

description: Curb Appeal made us walk in...5 hours later we left with a hand full of new friends and big smiles on our faces! The locals, service, pool table, and sports kept us there all day. Excellent Bar with great drink selection, good vibes and attentive Service (drink was never empty). We were exploring SF from LA, and my husband and I left McTeague's with a hand full of insider hot spots. It felt like we were with old friends when really they were new ones. Thanks Mike1 Mike2 and Mike's girlfriend for all your suggestions-we took them and had the best 5 days!
author: Urban D.

description:
i fuckin love this place!!

great beer selection!
great crowd and vibe!
great for watching games or after work and not too crowded
great if you want a lively semi crowded bar on weekend nights
Bartenders are amazing and very generous
the jukebox is phenomenal

go here and you may run into me
author: chris g.

description: Finally, a bar that addresses the concern of the customer who wants to have his game on, while getting his game on.  Where else can you choose between private booth, saddle, belly up, pool table room or open floor with your favorite game on flat screen under a Hunter S Thompson coffin lid?  Rumor that they will open early (10 AM)  to support the needs of a March Madness Thursday March 19, 2009 pub crawl crowd, warms me heart.  (Walking distance from Swan's Oyster Depot)
author: dag d.

description: The best place to watch soccer in San Francisco, period.  I have been to many pubs in North Beach, the Sunset, and Richmond, but this place is the best.  There is always a crowd even at 7am.  Beers are cheap, plenty of TVs, and Michael the bartender is awesome (despite him being a Chelsea fan....).  No other place to watch soccer in the city.
author: Drew C.

description: i like the saloon feeling of this place. seems like its been around forever and isn't trying too hard to be trendy. my favorite spot is the pool table area in the back because there's a lot more room to sit or stretch out and it's not too loud back there. the only drawback is that on weekends it can take forever to get the bartender's attention since it's always so packed in here. but once you do, it's worth it 'cause the beer is cheap and the company's good!
author: N. M.

description: My friends and I will never return!  Female bartender wasa witch.  Made an awful drink, which we politely asked to change for something else and she gave more attitude than I have ever seen.  Insecure girl thought she made the best drinks in town and said she is known for her drinks.  Told her it was nothing personal, just wasn't what we were expecting.  She was rude and went around to everyone talking about these rude people who didn't like her drink.  Managing bartender didn't seem to care that she was extremely rude and said it happened often and people mistook her "way as a Puerto Rican" for being rude.  I'm hispanic as well, so was a bit insulted.  She needs to realize she is in a SERVICE position and make customers happy rather than be a witch when someone expresses dislike for her amazing (amazingly awful) drinks.  Even the manager made an awful face when I explained how she made the drinks.  Will tell everyone I know to stay away from this place.  Awful.
author: J W.
